"American Hustle" was inspired by the Abscam operation of the early 1980s, in which the FBI entrapped a number of politicians -Congressmen and one US Senator among them- for taking bribes from wealthy Arab businessmen in return for political favor. The operation proved controversial when it became public, and the FBI was accused of overstepping its authority in creating crimes rather than investigating them. "American Hustle" draws on that criticism of the FBI to create a narrative that is downright distrustful of authority and goes so far as to elevate crooks and con artists to the status of anti-heroes. Makeup, wardrobe, and atmosphere steeped in 1970s pop culture, flamboyant behavior, and a strong cast combine to make this an enjoyable darkly comic grift film.

Irving Rosenfeld (Christian Bale) outgrew his family dry cleaning business and found success dealing in stolen and forged art and loan sharking before he met his match in Sydney Prosser (Amy Adams), an ambitious young New Yorker with a flair for English accents and manipulation. Together, they set up a loan scam to dupe clients out of $5000 each. Then they were caught by Richie DiMaso (Bradley Cooper), an FBI agent with his sights always set on bigger things. In exchange for leniency, DiMaso recruits Rosenfeld and Prosser to help set up some more con artists for him to arrest. They are to deliver 4 busts to fulfill their obligation. But the operation to hook more crooked art dealers and scam artists morphs into a public corruption investigation...and spins out of control.

Although the principle characters are based on real people, Sydney Prosser didn't have anything to do with Abscam. Carmine Polito (Jeremy Renner), Mayor of Camden tirelessly seeking investors for Atlantic City casinos, is more law-abiding than his real-life counterpart. You get the idea. The film opens with the statement: "Some of this actually happened." That's more honest than the usual "based on true events."

Director David O. Russell is adept at slowly turning the audience's sympathies from Rosenfeld's victims and his ambitious FBI persecutor to Rosenfeld and Sydney themselves. By the end of the film, the crooks have become anti-heroes. The strong anti-authoritarian undercurrent is surprising. But the film's rejection of any moral compass is puzzling, given that the writers seem to have intended a political message in criticizing the FBI's agenda and making its agents out to be either amoral and unstable or bureaucratic and impotent. While Russell's manipulation of the audience is effective, he uses a hackneyed gimmick to elicit sympathy for Rosenfeld: Rosenfeld sacrifices his own interests so as not to lose touch with his young adopted son. A bit saccharine for a grift movie.

"American Hustle" was widely praised by critics as one of the best films of 2013. One dissenter was Peter Debruge, who dismissed the film as "a collection of flamboyant 1970s caricatures run amok" and criticized its incoherence and sloppiness in "Variety". Other dissenting critics said much the same. I don't disagree with them. The film's flashback structure is awkward. It's too long and loaded with filler. The first half needs tighter editing. It's narratively sloppy and thematically confused. It's full of tangents that go no where. "American Hustle" has been overpraised. But it's fun, stylish, and the cast is admirable. Amy Adams is particularly strong and even overshadows her low-cut blouses, which are a major feature. I like the erratic interplay between Irving, Sydney, Richie, and Irving's wife Rosalyn (Jennifer Lawrence). This is not a masterpiece, but it's entertaining. Most of the credit should go to Amy Adams and costume designer Michael Wilkinson.

This rating is not on the movie but the product sold to me from Amazon.  There was no disclosure that the digital copy of the movie was not able to be loaded into my iTunes account with this product.  This is not only very disappointing, but in my opinion false advertising.  It is very common for consumers to expect to be able to use digital copies on iTunes and put their purchases on devices.  Sony & Amazon's advertising suggests the digital copy can be used for that, which is misleading.  I should not have to go to iTunes and purchase the product a second time, nor should I have to go to their web version for one movie.  Sony has no sense of customer relationships and refused to make this right, apparently too difficult to provide a redeem code through iTunes and cancel the code I provided them to do so.  Buyer Beware apparently.

Christian Bale stars as a balding con-artist named Irving Rosenfeld who meets and falls in love with Sydney Prosser, posing as English aristocrat "Lady Edith Greensly" Sydney helps Irving with his scams. When they are caught and captured by FBI agent Richie DiMaso, they are given a choice; either go to jail or help him with 4 additional arrests. They soon get mixed up with the Mafia and many schemes where Irving is forced to involve his wife. I would definitely consider watching this movie again someday. I highly recommend AMERICAN HUSTLE!!!

American Hustle is a fine example of a Film, it has sublime Direction, perfect writing, and great characters backed by amazing performances, making it a brilliant period piece, so why do i like it as much as i should?
Maybe I'm too young to understand it or "get it", though at my age i thought i understood just about everything I'd need to enjoy movies. But i honestly can't say i enjoyed watching American Hustle, it did not entertain me, it is the textbook definition of a good movie but that is it, there's no style, no flair, i can't even tell you what genre the movie is. It could be a Crime-Comedy-Drama-Charter-Period movie, i really wanted to love american hustle, and i do... i just can't think of many good things to say about it, it was a well mad movie by all texbook definitions of how a well made movie should be made, But there's no art to it, when i see a Scorcesse or Tarantino movie i know i'm watching a scorcesse or Tarnatino movie, no one makes movies the way they do, if i wasn't a film geek i don't think i could tell you who directed this, The film is so sterilised of anything resembling a director's artistic touch that it could have been made by just about anyone
As for the Blu Ray release it's sony's usual excellence, with brilliant video and audio. the supplements are limited in number but satisfying in quality. I'm not sure if i can recommend American Hustle or Not, if you want to see how a film should be made by all mechanical definitions of film then by all means go right ahead, but if you're looking for something more auteur then i'd go with some of the other big movies of 2013 such as Her or Wolf of Wall Street

American Hustle is not a heist move, but rather a story about complex, ambitious, and conflicted personalities in difficult situations mostly of their own creation.  These people are certainly not virtuous,  but they are not totally evil either.  However in spite of lots of acting talent the movie is slow-moving & dull.  Worst of all, it didn't make me care about any on the characters.  Bradley Cooper's character is nearly pathetic enough to be interesting, but not really.  Overall it was as though the actors and filmmaker are telling us about complicated people in complicated circumstances but never really bringing those characters or circumstances to life.  Some weak movies have merit because of at least one actor's sparkling performance.  That is not the case here.  The performances are uniformly dull, shallow, and unconvincing.  Two stars is generous.

Amy Adams is so gorgeous, so stylish, so smart and so sexy in each and every nuance, every little twitch of her face and/or body, that every man will fall in love instantly; yet she never reveals all, reminding us of Ovid's Metamorphoses, I: 502, where the love-smitten Apollo is chasing the nymph Daphne: "and the parts that lie hidden, he thinks even better."  But wait, this review is supposed to be about the whole movie.  Christian Bale, whom this reviewer has always disliked, considering him somehow odious, shines here, perhaps because he plays a character whom we consider odious.  The plot doesn't seem terribly important.  It's liars telling lies to other liars; scammers scamming other scammers.  The FBI, which usually is so careful in propagating its public image, lets its hair down, literally.  The chief FBI man here, unshaven and looking and acting like a lowlife criminal himself, who lives with his mother and sets his hair in curlers at night, is nothing more than a big mouth, anxious to bring down any politician he can, by entrapment or any other means, in order to gain notoriety for himself.  This movie is not a serious drama, but a farce, unbelievable but funny much of the time.  Where else can you find a Mexican sheik, or an Italian mafia capo who speaks Arabic?  This movie doesn't end; it just peters out, and when it does, we don't care too much what happens to whom.  Jennifer Lawrence as Bale's wife is stunningly gorgeous, as is the actress playing the wife of mayor Polito.  It's a fun watch.

Another great cast great story. I usually don't purchase so many DVD 's but this past year I purchased around five of the academy award movie winners and I've gotten my money's worth cause I shared with several co-workers who didn't make it to see all the great movies from this year.

The story was predictable, clich and weak. Despite all the high powered actors and period styles, a boring, boring, movie. Watch the trailer then stare at the wall for an hour, you will be better off.

This movie has it all, great acting, drama, suspense, twists & turns, Love, jealousy, copes, con artists & the mafia.. Acting was good by all parties, but the movie didn't strike a chord for me. Perhaps it was just the plot...professional con artists.
Excellent movie, kept us on edge from top to bottom, going to watch it again with my mother, shee will enjoy it.

This movie has so many references to 70s style and cliche' that it leaves your head spinning like a top.
The people that really were alive in the 70s will appreciate this movie more for the throwbacks, but even a new kid or someone born in this century will find the movie entertaining. It's story plays out like a story from goodfellas, but the main guy in this movie is just an average street hustler making scraps. He somehow works his way up to "millionaire" deals and the funny business ensues. Back then millionaire was the most anyone could ever have, the "B" word was not being used yet. At some point the story was taking a back seat to J Law's two Bazingas ( O.O ) OMFG. I had to laugh at some point just because everyone was so serious about nothing. You will want to see the ending, just because you have to know when all the craziness stops.

To clarify, the acting was fantastic (by everyone), the costuming was amazing, and overall the movie was extremely well dome. But, I just didn't care for the story, or the movie or the characters at all. The movie left me feeling bad in a way that I can't even describe very well. I didn't like the characters or their relationships with each other. And I didn't like how the story was resolved. The entire thing left me feeling quite unsettled. However, kudos to Christian Bale for his physical transformation to play Irving. Truly amazing!

In between this movie and the wolf of wall street, I really expected more. It feels like the movie drags on forever and I think it's just cause the main reason for the whole thing comes out at the very end, which unless you're paying attention, can be easily missed. I guess maybe it just wasn't my kind of movie. Great cast and what could have been a great plot but I think the fact that it was an "era" or time period movie kind of made it all get lost in translation.
Excellent! Loved the big finish! Layers, so you gotta be patient. But it is totally worth it in the end!

The male leads were just unattractive.  Amy Adams is no femme fatale and Jennifer Laurence was just plain wasted in her supporting role.  Maybe I just like Laurence too well but the whole movie left a bad taste in my mouth.

So boring, formulaic, cliched. It just plods on and on. Nothing fun, clever, or unique about it. I cannot fathom why all the reviews were so overwhelmingly positive, to say nothing of the awards. I wasted 2 hours of my life watching this, maybe you can avoid doing the same.

Saw this over the holidays and it's a great entertainment. There are many layers to the plot, which never stops developing and makes this a terrific fun time, but I was struck by the many layers in this film, the best American film I've seen in a decade! AMERICAN HUSTLE (2013) is by far the best comedy-caper film I have seen in decades!

The cast is uniformly excellent, the gags are genuinely funny, the dialogue is intelligent, and the plot twists are plausible but nearly always unforeseeable. And the film has a "good heart"! Non-traditional, unexpected kindness and generosity triumph and leave us feeling good at the end.

Christian Bale sets the tone at the very start as Irving Rosenfeld, a world-class conman with a potbelly and the most amazing hair comb-over! Laughable as he is and crooked as he is, he and his partner-mistress Sydney Prosser (Amy Adams) are made sympathetic to us by their voice-over comments that reveal their backgrounds, their goals, and their high-functioning mental processes.

Bradley Cooper is hilarious as Richie DiMaso, a hyper-ambitious curly-haired FBI agent, who lusts for Sydney Prosser and forces her and Irving to help him entrap an array of Congressmen and a New Jersey mayor (Jeremy Renner) with a bribe-offering sting called ABSCAM.

Among many loose cannons, the biggest is Irving's wife Rosalyn (Jennifer Lawrence), who is receptive to the amorous advances of a powerful mobster. Will she reveal what Irving and the others are up to? Will she cause Irving to be harmed ...? Will she ...?

And, as the film approaches its ending, two of the characters decide that they will take an all-new kind of control of the whole situation. And YOUR job may be to try to spot it as it happens ... IF it is happening. Or to spot it being derailed.

As with that great comedy-caper film THE STING (1973; Robert Redford and Paul Newman), despite this explicit heads-up from these two characters, 999,999 viewers out of a million will be totally surprised by the outcome. But very pleasantly surprised if they've been paying attention.

For me, the only factor that gives THE STING a very slight advantage over AMERICAN HUSTLE is its great musical score that featured those wonderful ragtime melodies of Scott Joplin.

This film deserves a VERY strong "A+" grade.

Great soundtrack too well picked out songs and score help to set the tone, if you like a smart intelligent drama with a good story its a must see, con-men, corruption and mafia are a great cocktail with such an amazing cast! Man, was I disappointed in this movie. I was a young man in the service when ABSCAM occured, and this movie just didn't hit the mark on the whole "feel" of the operation's aims and the general public's view of the whole matter. But, I realize movies can be made that take a true story, and totally tell another tale when all is said and done. I don't agree with this strategy personally, and I don't understand why a movie maker would pick a story and re-tell it different from fact anyway. Why not just tell your own tale if you think it's good enough. Artistic license is one thing, but re-making a tale is another.
There was some good in this story telling though and I'm not rating the maker(s) effort on that score, just the fact that the movie wasn't really telling the tale of ABSCAM IMHO. The actors are solid as you'd expect and it seems they even get into their character's persona well enough to be convincing. If you don't know anything about ABSCAM, I'd wait until after you see the movie to research it if your inclined or curious to find out about it. I wouldn't recommend finding out first, as you will be like me and you will be "waiting" for certain landmarks in the story, and certain facts to surface, and certain events to happen, and it just won't happen.
I guess one could also say that it was the ABSCAM story with the focus just somewhere other than center.

In many ways this is a uniquely American story. It's a story about gaming the "system". A very fast-moving film with good, convincing actors who are not sympathetic in the conventional, movie-script way. The four principle actors in this film are out to screw each other. I bought this film mainly to see the performance of Christian Bale who is an extraordinarily gifted actor. He morphs physically into the characters he plays on screen. IMO, he deserved an Academy Award for his performance. Bradley Cooper, as the FBI agent straddling between his job as a federal agent and his part in stinging a corrupt New Jersey mayor (splendidly played by Jeremy Renner) was superb. Jennifer Hudson and Amy Adams were good in their supporting roles. My one negative comment had to do with the costumes worn by Amy Adams throughout the film. I remember the '70's but I don't recall women walking around semi-naked in broad daylight, in meetings, etc., Amy Adams could have played that role without having to display her breasts in every scene. Her beauty and talent are enough to add to any film.

This is an AMAZING movie, worthy of a second viewing just to appreciate the fast, subtle character developments and storytelling done with actor looks and reactions, etc. This movie is all about the reality of the "grayness" of Life choices.

The Love Quadrangle is complex and ever-shifting. We (my wife and I watched and commiserated together) don't have anything to validate this opinion, but we suspect that many of the folks contributing low ratings and comments about "boring" etc. are likely younger and/or less-experienced/less-open to seeing and reading minute facial looks, off-hand remarks, etc. If you are oblivious to such subtleties in Real Life or if you think that such relationship dynamics are themselves boring, you are not very likely to tune into them on screen and so much of this movie would be lost on you. (That's not a good or bad thing, it just means you and David O. Russell have different sensibilities about storytelling and movie-making.)

What this movie did for us -- besides being VERY entertained BOTH times we watched it -- "American Hustle" put David O. Russell on our short list of working Hollywood directors who make GREAT movies which puts him in the company of such talents as the inimitable Coen Brothers.

Finally, the sets, costumes, and above all, the soundtrack are all GREAT, too.

American Hustle takes its time in every way. The story evolves slowly, but is worth a watch because the acting and set up are actually quite good. There's a combination love triangle and political fraud going on, as well as countless subplots that are all woven together in a labyrinth of deceit that ultimately takes a toll on everyone, especially the desperate characters. The trouble is, the director and writer tried to do too much. It would have been better as a simple scam plot which would have given enough room for this fantastic cast to show their stuff. As it ended up it was too much of everything. And yet, I couldn't turn it off because it was a flashback to that era when disco was still popular and hustling was the name of the game. So, it was a bit of an expository spectacle worth the time and cash to visit.
Took FOREVER to get to the point. Way too much material. The movie could have been at least 30 minutes shorter and it would have been better for it.

American Hustled out of good money by misleading Ads.  The ads for this movie made you think it was a rollicking fun adventure about  the FBI and con men/women bringing down crime.  What you get is a 'poor me' hard drama that portrays the FBI as bumbling fools out to get 'poor misunderstood entrapped politicians' who just wanted to help their communities and not line their own dirty pockets, not to mention sympathetic, noble mafia who are never portrayed as scary (just believed to be, and of course, immediately understand that the hustler is going to help them escape the FBI), victims that are portrayed as 'suckers that deserve to have their life savings and hope destroyed', and so on.
Add to that, reality TV like camera work; mumbling script; poor me tirades; and ads that used a line and scene that wasn't even in the film (and helped portray it as a 'fun' movie) and you can understand why I feel so ripped off.  I forced myself to keep watching hoping it would get better, waiting for the 'fun' to kick in that the ads had promised me....they never came, and I'll never trust these directors again.

I was one of those victims/suckers the filmmakers have so much fun snubbing their noses at.  If you want a fun film, avoid this like the plague.  If you want a pro-criminal and crime, downer depressing drama, then go ahead, waste your money.

Another 2013 film dealing with another edgy subject, the con game, with a wonderful cast doing excellent work.  Bale is a master at burying himself in his character.  The personable con man who is strangely normal in many respects, a married man with a child he loves, working at odds with the law, picking up a brilliant partner, a girlfriend who is perhaps even better at the game than he is.  He is drawn into a sting operation by a cop who is full of himself and intending to put paid to the game and become the most important man in the force.

The game involves nave and savvy politicos, some of whom are taken in by the game and the other, the Mafia cleaner, who is not.  The bad guys, Bale's character and his girlfriend, are the true savvy players who try to bring the game to a satisfactory end, for whom?  Themselves, the mob, the cops, the politicos?  Twists and turns and an insight into the game that is interesting in itself.

Ms Lawrence has no worries being typecast for her Hunger Games role.  The other star was for Amy Adams assets.

Having spent my '20s in the '70s, I expected a more accurate portrayal of the period.  Instead, it is all a bit jumbled, there are glaring errors, and the fashions look like they were taken from movies of the '70s, not from the actual clothing people wore.

Jennifer Lawrence and Amy Adams deserve their awards for their performances.  Christian Bale does well as the grafter.  But Bradley Cooper is, well, Bradley Cooper.  He's playing the usual character, varying only for whether he's playing someone who's sniveling, or someone who is bullying.  Here he plays both.

The representation of the FBI is not consistent with actual FBI culture, but at least it avoids the usual fawning image of the FBI as clockwork, cookie cutter agents who are either good or bad according to the script.  In this case, they are all sniveling, bumbling, and clueless.

And in fact this is what I don't care for in the movie.  Not a single character has any redeeming feature that would make you care what happens to them.  Amy Adams, a personal favorite, acts well - but has nothing to work with.  Her character lacks qualities that call for sympathy.  And she's the best of the lot.  The rest, you just want to see something bad happen to, but there isn't anyone in the movie that you want to see succeed in doing it to them.

For all its praise, this movie left me cold.  I made it through to the end, but it will go in the "donate" box, rather on the "watch again" shelf.

For all that we revere the farmer, the soldier, the statesman, the law enforcer, the clergyman and the hero, we Americans have always reserved a special place in our hearts for the outlaw, the gangster, the card shark, the con man, the hustler. Its a trait that goes to the very core of our identity as a people, a crucial element in our national mythology. From our most humble beginnings, hustling has stood as a time-honored tradition, a value as American as apple pie. Indeed, whole genres of literature and popular entertainment have sprung up around this idea. And for all the lip service we pay to what we righteously call the Protestant work ethic, we cant help but subversively admire those who are able to achieve the American Dream through less noble and less arduous means. Indeed, our history is populated with scoundrels and scalawags weve somehow managed to turn into folk heroes, and, while today our grifters operate on Wall Street or in corporate boardrooms rather than on the western frontier, the characteristics are the same: they're all just slick-talking manipulators operating outside the system and making a fortune while doing so. And, oh, how we love it! Unless its being done to us, of course; then, were not so crazy about it, which is why when it involves political corruption, the fleecing of us the taxpayer, we may no longer be quite so forthcoming in our admiration.

American Hustle is David O. Russells smart and savvy tribute to the con artist in all of us. He and his co-writer, Eric Warren Singer, have chosen to set their work in the 1970s, an age of polyester suits, ultra-wide lapels and bad comb-overs. It was also host to one of the biggest financial scandals of the modern era, Abscam, an FBI sting operation that resulted in the convictions of a mayor (played by Jeremy Renner), a United States Senator, six United States congressmen and an assortment of state officials from New Jersey and Pennsylvania on bribery and corruption charges. American Hustle starts off by declaring that SOME of this actually happened, and, indeed, the movies often absurdly comic, larger-than-life quality makes us question the veracity of a good deal of what were seeing. But no matter because the movie is clearly more a study in character and theme than it is a factual recounting of the events of history (which explains why all the names have been changed to protect the guilty).

And what a cast of characters Russell has gathered for our amusement and delectation! A paunchy, balding Christian Bale plays Irving Rosenfeld, a natural-born shyster whos found a way to earn money (to the tune of $5,000 a crack) through offering loans to people desperate for cash, money these down-on-their-luck individuals will never see. Irving is married to Rosalyn (Jennifer Lawrence), a scatterbrained chatterbox who is so high maintenance that Irving is forced to live on his own even though he supports her and her son, whom hes adopted as his own. Irvings problem is that for all his willingness to rip off people, he may be just a tad too softhearted to be very lucrative at his profession. Enter Sydney Prosser (Amy Adams), an attractive woman with some secrets of her own who becomes Irvings business partner and lover.  Theyre not in the business very long before undercover FBI agent Richie DiMaso (Bradley Cooper) blows the lid off their operation, offering them immunity from prosecution if theyll help take down some bigger fish. Richie is, in many ways, the focal point of the screenplay, a preening, overreaching lawman whose main concern is netting as many big fish in his net as he can in order to make a name for himself. Its not long before tensions are developing among the three principal players, and much of the movies fun derives from watching these two outsized figures, who find their value in being able to manipulate others to their own advantage, engaging in what amounts to a giant pi**ing contest over strategies, ethics and even Sydney herself.

As with any good tale of con artists and grifters, American Hustle beguiles us with the spectacle of hustlers hustling the hustlers, since, as were told, hustlers are ultimately just people doing what they need to do to survive. It gets to the point that not only do the characters not know whos telling the truth and whos playing whom, the audience cant tell either. And even though Richie thinks hes shrewd enough to play in the big leagues, he soon learns the bitter lesson that, when it comes to hustling, amateurs should never mess around with professionals.

Russell employs a dizzying whirlwind technique - consisting of fast-paced storytelling, energetic camerawork and editing, snappy dialogue, crisp narration - that puts one in mind of Goodfellas. Even when the action is set in an enclosed room, which is often the case, the movie never stops moving. Its alive and were alive to it. Moreover, the spot-on period details, especially the uber-tacky 70s fashions, only serve to heighten the absurd humor of the tale were watching.

American Hustle boasts one of the finest acing ensembles weve come across in quite some time, which, in addition to the main cast, includes Louie CK, Michael Pena and Robert De Niro, among others.

Theres a manic energy in both the performances and the filmmaking in American Hustle that perfectly reflects the soul of a nation founded on youthful vigor and anti-establishment rule-breaking. And indeed its that uniquely American spirit of anarchic iconoclasm that Russell captures to such memorable effect in American Hustle.

Many of the one-star reviews here share similar complaints. This movie is being called boring, hard to follow, and not worth spending the money for a rental or, months ago, a movie ticket.

I saw this movie in theaters, and again through Amazon Instant. It was great the first time, and a bit better the second. To me, calling this movie boring is just weird. There are no dull moments from start to finish. Calling it hard to follow is a bit more understandable (I guess), but there is hardly any mystery in this movie! It is laid out neatly, but I noticed a trend while reading the one-star reviews: Most of the people who strongly disliked this movie lack the ability to pay attention or follow a story. They are expecting to be spoon fed and handed certain emotional reactions that they've grown to believe make a "good" movie. I don't think their interest in watching a movie goes beyond "This movie scared me!" or "This movie made me sad!".

The movie was a brilliant art film with top notch actors and a story that is authentic and real. People don't like the film because it doesn't get to the point, as if life is just about our birth, highest achievement, and then death. The movie elegantly explores the moments in between and the relationships between real characters and subtly builds the main character and keeps you interested in the many dynamics of the films themes while leaving you in the tantalizing dark about the plot - brilliant. There are many moral themes playing out in which establishment ethics and street code battle out to wits end and in the end the good guy wins; which is really just a cherry on top of a classic tasteful American Sunday. Each character is perfected and their growth through the film is therapeutically cathartic. A truly classic adult film shot how a great book reads, in a sea of never ending shell shock attempting grindhouse wannabe films. A must see, more than once.

I was really looking forward to seeing this movie because there was so much talk about it. Unfortunately, there wasn't any part throughout the movie where I found myself thinking "I can't wait to see what happens next." Not a whole lot happened and nothing was very exciting. Amy Adams and Christian Bale were both great as far as acting goes but that's about it! I would not recommend it.
Great movie! Its so convenient to have this tied to my amazon as I can watch it anywhere. Cheap then purchasing DVD and you can purchase higher quality versions if desired.

I can't say enough good things about this movie: wonderful acting, terrific dialog, amazingly accurate sets, hair styles and wardrobes, not too mention the engaging plot that raises many thought-provoking questions about the nature of corruption in our society.  It is worth watching just to see the phenomenal performance by Jennifer Lawrence.  I plan to see it again, and again.

This movie had a lot of recognitions and awards, didn't watch it in the theater cause sometimes movies that won awards really do not impress me...but this movie impressed me..from the screenplay, acting, directorial and i was taken back to the 70's with the way the cinematography was done , the set, costume design etc...The biggest surprise to me are the actors in this film they are truly topnotch! Congratulations!
This movie was excellent. I enjoyed the story, the characters and the actors in the film. Definitely would recommend to everyone!

Often with ensemble casts, the movie may suffer from some dead-weight acting. Not the case with American Hustle. From the minor to leading roles, everyone is superb. The plot line is complex, but the characters are all the while interesting enough to keep one hooked. One last plug--Christian Bale is outstanding, his best acting yet.

In spite of the hype....we were dumbfounded. Granted, there were fantastic performances. Really great acting, but the plot was all over the place, really draggy , and it just left us befuddled at how something like this made it into the category of "best picture!"

Nasty subject, I did not even finish watching.........just not for me I guess.

I rented this because the critics raved about, I just found it depressing.
I was actually disappointed in this much anticipated, highly touted film. It was mediocre. Not terrible, but not very good.

The actors do such an amazing job of characterizing the relationships, the story line and like a good book that you want to find out the end of but don't want it to end, the whole film just keeps you engaged. Would highly recommend.
Riveting film.  Amazing cast, superb acting and a dynamic script take the viewer on a ride that is not to be missed.
The Christian Bale character is outstanding, and Jennifer Lawrence is amazing as well.  The twist at the end was jaw dropping.
I loved this movie! Great actors! and real life story! One of the best movies I have seen in the last 5 years!
Blah. Moved to slow!  Too long. Lost interest in the first 30 minutes. Expected more excitement. Wouldnt recommend wasting money
The language in the movie was course and the plot was somewhat plodding. Not very believable although the cast and costuming were very good.
Slow moving I would not rent this again.  Characters did not do a go job of portraying the situation.. Thumbs down.
I didn't like it.....it was a great story and could have  been intense and exciting.  Instead, it was hokey.  Just not my cup of tea.
The acting was phenomenal!  Truly great performances by the entire cast and the set and costumes were spot on.  However, I just didn't like the story never bought into it.

The actors did fantastic jobs, but the story dragged in several scenes.  I feel that a tighter editing of the movie would have significantly improved the overall movie.  I found myself checking the time to see how much longer the movie would go on.
Didn't care for it.  Can't see what all the fuss was about.  Felt it was too much.  Looked as if each actor was trying to outdo the other.
Strange, and very hard to follow the plot, and scenes that seemed to be in for no reason.  Definitely not worth even $5 to rent it.
Ultimately we found this movie gratuitous and disappointing.  Just didn't like it, Oscar or not.  Wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
There was a problem and I couldn't get it to download so I couldn't finish watching it can i get a refund?
Don't know why it got all of the rave reviews that it did. It was really kind of slow and a little boring.

This movie was so lost on us. I remember hearing so many wonderful things. We love the cast. And even with all that - it was such a dud.  So boring. So predictable. I was never invested in any of the characters.
Christian Bale was amazing in this.  A couple times it was hard to follow the plot line, but overall an excellent and very entertaining movie
It had great actors but I kept waiting for something to happen.. Somewhat boring.. It was just "eh" for me...
Oscar winner for sure.  Great acting and performances by all.  I have seen the film three times and find it gets better each time.
"Tawdry", "mumbly", "cheap" and  "tacky" are the first words that come to mind. Amy Adams was the only bright spot and she was far too elegant abd dignified to be cast in so trivial a film.
American Hustle is superb, from the casting, to how it's shot, the (many uncredited) cameos, the music; all just fantastic. Unlike a lot of Hollywood films, it's not entirely predictable, either...
Good movie. A little hard to follow at first but i like the way it came back around. Four stars

I rented this movie to play on my iPad for a recent flight.  Plugged in my earphones and watched the movie.  I didn't hear airplane noise or any other noise for the 2 to 3 hours it took to arrive at my destination.  The movie was excellent and I'm planning on renting another for my trip home.
This movie have some of the best acting ever. Christian Bale was truly exceptional along with his co-stars. Bravo! American Hustle.
Great movie! Christian Bale the Best !!! Amy Adam's English accent was not really convincing. But overall the great story!!!
Total babe feast for the eyes. Jennifer Lawrence, Christian Bale, Bradley Cooper,  Amy Adams and Louis C.K. all hot. The movie is good too.
I really enjoyed it. It made me laugh. Kept waiting for Amy Adams' boobs to make an appearance but spoiler they didn't.
Worst movie I saw in a long time. Lasted through 1 hour before I had to turn it off. Not sure why this movie got such high ratings

Movie was okay but the technical problems are still there - no ability to cast to tv so had to watch on a computer screen - disappointing. Also, never confirmed the buy so was unaware I had actually purchased it - don't like that either.

It might have some top name stars, but that is all it has.  Might be based on truth. However, it is full of people making very bad choices and hurting people. No redeeming value. Save your money and your time.

This film is based on a real set of people and events. If you go and do a web search on the real people you come away with a feeling of "dirtiness" or at best of the conflict that the Federal Government is in with its own people. When you then link the story to the level of greed being portrayed the same feeling of "dirtiness" obtains.

I still am surprised by the levels to which both sides of these conflicting forces will stoop to reach their desired goals.

The movie has great production values and the acting is superb but the "dirtiness" left by the actions portrayed by the end of the film is difficult to shake it off.
heald interest well, good music and interesting twist at the end. All around good flick. I would reccomend this movie to others
Over hyped as with anything from Hollywood.  A little slow but worth a watch.  No real lasting appeal other than very good acting.

It is not very often that my husband and I get a sitter to see a movie in the theater ... We did for this.  The hype was amazing and we were so excited.  The entire cast are amazing in their own right and we were excited to see them together!

Unfortunately, it left me wanting to ask for our money back!  It felt like the movie was 5hrs long and the plot/story line were just ok.
Great scene with Robert Dinero and Christian Bale....towards the end of the movie. I would recommend this to anyone. All of the actors were awesome.

Actually saw the movie in theatre. Bought the movie for neighbor who is dying from cancer.  It was beyond a 'hit'.  He looks so like one of the characters.  He was beyond pleased.  One of best movies I have ever seen.

Watching this was like being forced to watch two plus hours of  Gary Gutter service commercials. Those in Rockland county know
what I mean. All others can google.

I tried watching this movie last night and fell asleep as it didn't keep up my interest.  I rented this movie only because of the Academy Awards nominations but soon found out I had a hard time hearing the mumbling of the characters as well as any excitement.
Perhaps this movie would delight others and capture their interest but for me, it did not.
After all the hype about this movie, I thought it would be a lot better than it was.  It was just ok.

If you're old enough to remember the '70s and the ABSCAM sting, you'll really enjoy how much they got right.  The cast is superb and the whole look and feel of the thing brings back memories of those heady days.  Loved it!
Previews hype it up.  Doesn't really hold your attention throughout the film.  Good actors, but a poorly produced film.  Eh...
may be ok for free tv,  not worth the money, poor development of an interesting story mediocre acting making the movie long

An amazing script with the actors necessary to do it justice. Direction, photography (love the scenes inside the dry cleaning carousel) and all other facets were top notch. I had seen it in the theater and this rental was my second viewing. It will become part of my library...

I enjoyed this movie a great deal.  But I remember the incident well.  I am from New Jersey and at the time was employed in law enforcement.  So many of my colleagues and followed the incident as it unfolded.  I knew the US Senator who was caught up in the sting as well.  So, all in all, it brought back memories for me.  Furthermore, I was impressed by the players.  They did a great job.  But I am always most impressed by Jenifer Lawrence.  I have seen her in several movies and believe that she possesses the "knack."  That undefinable quality necessary to pull off any roll she acts.  There were no dead spots in the movie either.  It flowed seamlessly.  In my judgment it is well worth the price of admission.
The start was odd but as the movie progressed it became more engaging.  The ending was somewhat expected, but not quite the end one thought!
Interesting storyline. There are some great actors in the film. Christian Bale is spectacular. Fun to see all these great cast coming together.
A great movie from start to finish. The blu ray was likewise great, both visually and sonically. A new favorite of mine and plan on watching it again soon.
A very good movie with a great story line along with great actors. some might find this movie slow but it is very good
Amazing film bringing together incredible actors who play unique characters. Each actor brings to life the emotions and energy of this very unique, "American Hustle".
As always, the movie glorifies the truth and throws a little extra in there. I read the true background online and compared the two. For movie's sake, it was good, but not entirely accurate.
My internet service went down so the allotted time ran out before I got to see all of the movie.  However, what I did see was very good.  Guess I'll have to fork out another $5 to see the rest.

I had high hopes for this movie, since I remember the Abscam affair and was interested in the background.  They had me interested and engaged for most of the movie, then seemingly couldn't decide whether they were making a drama or a comedy. Some of Bradley Cooper's lines seem like they were lifted out of one of the Hangover movies.  Yes, the acting was good, but in the end I was more disappointed in this movie than any other in a long time.

A great-looking movie with a good soundtrack and good actors, but little in the way of story or interest. Borrowed heavily from Scorcese films like Goodfellas, but fails to match the quality of his films. That isn't to say it's the worst movie you'll see this year, but it's certainly not deserving of all the acclaim it's received.
Good movie, good acting by all.  Had to pay close attention in order to determine at times who was conning who.

But not much as it turns out...this is a highly fictionalized account of the ABSCAM Scandal of the late 70's/early 80's. I know this film has been critically acclaimed and was a big box office success; and it has received some awards recognition. The performances, especially by Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence, are masterful; and Christian Bale and Bradley Cooper's performances are commendable too. But I was so disappointed in the degree of fictionalization of the ABSCAM Scandal - a story with I believe is worth telling - that I could not bring myself to to give it the highest rating. For example, the Camden, NJ mayor (played by Jeremy Renner) is portrayed as a selfless politician who gets involved in the scam only to provide jobs for his constituents. In reality, though Camden mayor Angelo Errichetti was widely praised for caring about the people of Camden, he also had a reputation for corruption. During the real ABSCAM operation, he offered to get the fake sheik into illegal businesses such as money counterfeiting and drug smuggling. That is just one glaring example...there are many others. I was also turned off by the gratuitous profanity, nudity and sex...which made the film difficult to watch at times. I'm giving the film four stars for the performances of the main characters; but I likely will not watch the movie again.
Arrived on time and I enjoyed watching it. A very good and interesting movie. Well acted and so well done. It is a prize.
Well-written, well-acted Hollywood entertainment.  But this understates Christian Bale's performance;  he's so compelling that I would almost see a movie just because he is in it.
The movie has a lot of twists and turns. This is a complex yet logical and digestable film with excellent acting.

This is the story of a musical phenomenon that conquered the globe with all the flair and fervor of Beatlemania at its height.  It's 1975, and a new dance craze, "The Hustle" is sweeping America.  Before the year is out, the lingering tumult of  the Watergate scandal will be swept away as millions of Americans don their dancin' shoes and hoof the night away at Studio 54.  Anyone who lived through those heady days of flaired pants and bra burnings will find themselves grinning from ear to ear as disco and polyester come to dominate the cultural landscape on a planetary scale, making friends of foes, fostering hope where hate once fermented, and bringing our world to the very precipice of a united whole for the first time in our collective history.  It didn't last -- it couldn't last -- but we still have the music to remind us what might have been...
The cast was great... Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Lawrence, and Robert De Niro together again!  I don't think the real ABSCAM crew looked this great.
Funny, gritty film with a wonderful script and cast. Plenty of twists that keep you guessing and the running time flys by. My only complaint is that there was not enough Jennifer Lawrence.

Everybody is hustling somebody in this one.  Christian Bale is a small-time hustler who gets drawn into a really big hustle that's over his head.  But his girlfriend thinks she's up to the challenge, and even the FBI guy is hustling to make the arrest that will really advance his career.  Very cleverly written and well acted.  Kudos to the makeup person who developed Bale's way over-the-top comb-over, which is really something to see.

American Hustle is well acted and well filmed, but that does not make it entertaining. It is INCREDIBLY slow and Waaaaaaaaay too loooooong - It could have been done in half the time. According to the opening, some of it is true. If the writers were going to play that loosely with the real story, they could have easily played loosely enough to make it more interesting.

What is with the new glitch of the movie buffering and then restarting 10 - 20 back to previously watched section of movie? It took twice as long to view the movie and of course lost the mood set by the scene it dropped from.
Slow and boring. Not at all what I expected. Sorry I bought it instead of renting it. Never again will I buy first.

And that was about it. I thought the premise of the movie was interesting, it isn't a type of movie I would usually watch but I enjoy seeing Jennifer Lawrence on screen, she didn't fail to perform. I am also a fan of Christian and he did quite well also.

As for the story, it was only just okay for me. I wasn't sure what to expect going into except that the move won a bunch of awards. Unsure what exactly was so spectacular about it but it is definitely rent-able if you have nothing else going on.

After the initial shock of seeing Christian Bale as fat, I enjoyed his character development from kill of the hill to minor player.  Amy Adams truly knew how to use men.  Jennifer Lawrence wasn't the dumb blonde.  Bradley Cooper's character showed if you worked real hard your boss may take the credit.
Very entertaining grifter movie that floats above most with their twist as to who's being grifted.  For me the ending was too gleefully soft.

While Batman with a receding hairline may be a little hard to swallow, everything about this film delivered.  From tense moments to passionate exchanges, the best feature to American Hustle are the people who's lives it follows (and almost ultimately destroys).  No crazy action or gratuitous sex here, but a riveting story none the less, and as long as you're not mindless you'll have a great time watching it.  Especially when you're trying to figure it all out for yourself when it's all over.

The Good:
Gripping performances that evoke real emotion
Incredible soundtrack
Written in a way that will keep you glued (mostly) the entire time

The Bad:
The British accent thing pissed me off more than once (but not enough to truly hurt the experience)
Love the cast.  Good performances by all, particularly Jennifer Lawrence, but this movie was slow and had trouble keeping my attention.
Sorry wait to it goes on prime time . Why ? becuase although it has a great actors . The plot is alright but the characters lack soul . Thier is no moral emotion . It was so rushed and so jaded
Loved the cast of characters.  Amazing acting. The storyline was o.k.  I watched it on my computer -  would have enjoyed watching it on a regular television though.
Funny....Great ending and Sound track; but too many side stories that didn't connect for me. Not one I have to own.

I enjoyed this movie because you really could not tell what was going to happen next. All the actors, Christian Bale, Jennifer Lawrence, Bradley Cooper and Amy Adams defiantly gave their best. Jennifer Lawrence looks a bit young, but that is not a terribly distracting component in the movie.
Worst movie this year horrible acting, actors just reciting lines, no one in character very poor audio quality difficult picking out dialog save your money on this one - Goodfellas, Casino it anint

I was completed impressed at the acting in this movie -- Christian Bale, Jennifer Lawrence, Matthew McConaughey, Bradley Cooper -- they all did a fantastic job at playing the characters and telling a compelling story.
Too long- seemed to drag and drag. We fell asleep both times re watching. Movie was ok. Cast is great.
Very Disappointed The Movie Was Definitely Hyped Up. Couldn't Get In ToThe Movie. My Wife Feel Asleep 20 Minutes Into It.
Good pace, interesting characters, great acting.  Pretty engrossing plot. We enjoyed it from start to finish.  Definitely recommend this movie.
Great 70's eye candy, fun plot with decent character development and stellar performances. We were sorry to see it end.
The 1970's was my ' coming of age' era, loved the plot, loved the fashion, the styles, etc, captivating from start to finish!
Not sure what the hype was about.  The actors were very good but the story was choppy.  Bale seems to never disappoint.
I highly recommend this movie.  One of the best at the Oscars this year.  Also great costume design for the movie.
Thought this movie was good, but didn't love it. Gotta admit the comb over was pretty amazing! I'd still recommend it to people.
Some very good acting!....The story was slow and convoluted. I gave it this rating for the acting and the era replication. The directing was flawed.
I chose 5 stars because I loved the plot twist.  The acting was great.  Lesson to learn, don't con a con.
This movie was slow, I am not sure what all the hype was. The acting was good but the story was weak.
Engaging plot, get to know the characters; you feel like you're part of the movie.  Most movies can't achieve what this one has.  Highly entertaining.
I remember the scandal that this story was based on, but never really knew the details.  Great movie and great lessons to be learned from it.
I felt it was a poor story,it did not hold my interest. Slow moving,stupid scenes,not much action. Do not waste your money!

This movie started off slow and never picked up. There were two good parts to this movie. One, good soundtrack. Two, the fact that it had an ending.

The marketing for this movie was excellent. The previews looked great, but the actual movie was disappointingly flat. The backstory was good, then the rest of the movie falls flat remaining unengaging and slow until the predictable ending where the story comes together. I am usually pretty easy to please as far as movies go. However, if someone was having a movie party and selected this, I would be forced to leave. Or drink heavily to stave off the absolute boredom.
Great movie, great cast.  Not a dull moment-quick and to the point.  I highly recommend to other viewers.  No regrets

Acting and soundtrack were excellent.really liked the scene in the disco, brought back some memories. Overall the movie was very entertaining. Had to pay close attention to the plot to understand the characters.

All the hype about movies is meant to make you want to go see it .Spend money at a theater, buy or rent it. Unless the movie is something special I don't spend money to see it. I pay for cable so why pay twice to see a movie that I can see for free on cable. I listened to the hype and rented it but it is not rent worthy. Wait until it comes  on cable and watch it for free. Shame on me for listening to the hype.
Best part of movie was watching Bradley Cooper dance and the 70's soundtrack.  Weird movie.  Did not deserve the academy award nomination in my opinion.

Started very slow and continued to be slow till the last 30mins.  The ending was pretty good but can't make up for the first 3/4's of the movie.  Not sure it was worth the time and even more confused as to how this was considered one of the years best movies.  Doesn't say much for the others.....

Too many F-bombs in the movie. This is not necessary.  Better dialog needed.
It did have an interesting plot however.
After the reviews, I expected more substance in the script. The actors were excellent. Amy Adams was tougher than her usual characters. Jennifer Lawrence was great. She is talented and versatile.
This film caught the flavor and bravado of a culture recently aggrandized by cocaine and drunk with hubris. See it now!
One of the most clever, entertaining and interesting movies that I have watched in a long time, the amazing cast and the great story keep the viewer intrigued and surprised.
Somewhere between the idea of a squeeze and the soundtrack, I thought I was watching a remake of the Robert Redford movie The Sting, didn't impress me, but thanks for the opportunity to rent it.
This movie was excellent in every way.  Cast, characters, story, cinematography, set, etc.  Truly a 'must-see'.  Christian Bale was phenomenal.

Great performances by Bradley, Christian, Amy and Jennifer. It's one of those movies you need to watch more than once to understand the meaning of the movie, so we will probably buy the movie. The F word is a little over-used, but that seems to be the norm in today's movies. I can't wait to watch it again.

This is the stupidest movie I've ever rented.  One of those self-aggrandizing hollywood piles of wasted film people say they like because they think it makes them sound smarter than they think they are.  Glad I didn't waste good movie popcorn by seeing it at the theater.  When you get a bunch of hollywood 'stars' sitting around with nothing to do but sell their names, this is the silly excuse for entertainment they produce.  Probably win a million academy awards ... which is hollywood swelled heads patting themselves on the back for being so great.  Watch an old Batman re-run instead; least ways you know what you're getting going in.
Just wasn't our happy go lucky Sat. evening fun movie. Way too seedy for us. such a sad slice of life.

Any film dealing with "scams" or "con men" will, by definition, be deceptive, convoluted hazy and hard to follow.  And "American Hustle" is no exception.  In fact, the buzz surrounding this production is overrated.  To this viewer, it's the kind of movie where you might a well sit back and simply enjoy the acting and not really worry about, "Fully grasping what's going on and what the hell just happened". There are some movie spoiler sites online that you can turn to for a blow by blow examination of the plot, but even these synopses seem to go on forever.
I thought it was a good, entertaining movie, but I feel that it fell somewhat short of all the Oscar hype.

We had  to resume the movie six times due to streaming difficulties.
The two lead women were exceptional but our overall enjoyment watching this movie was just okay.
Hard tale to follow unless you are an Abscam scandal fan.  Sting on top of sting with no scorecard to sort out the players until the end.  Need to watch it at least twice.
The movie was interesting and entertaining, there were some slow spots, maybe better editing would have helped.  Great cast, but the stars weren't utilized to their max.
Predictable in most respects, full of stupid humor and stereotypes, but there was some memorable acting by Amy Adams, a few fun scenes, and just enough plot to be worth watching.
AMAZING....VERY FUN...LOVED THE SOUNDTRACK!! One of the best movies I have seen in a long time. Great acting for all the characters.

Maybe I'm jealous of young, beautiful women, but I think Amy Adams and J-Law phoned this in.  I don't think their bodies should be characters in the film.  I would like to have seen more range in their line delivery.  In my opinion, the male characters were more talented and interesting.  The subject matter is disturbing to me, but I wanted to see the movie because it is based on real events.  When I read about Abscam after I saw the movie, I was impressed with how much Bale's character looked like the real person his character was based on.  I didn't like the camera work.  Oh well, now I'm closer to my goal of seeing all the nominated movies.

Thought this would be a fun movie to watch, ended up turning it off and watching a Kevin Hart stand up special instead (which I also turned off).

Second attempt to watch was not much better. Character development is off pace and chemistry between actors is lacking. I like all of the actors, but am confused about all the critical acclaim the movie received.

I remember abscam in the news when it happened.  I was very busy at the time with a job and family but this
picture really brought back memories.
Great movie. Suspense packed.  I liked how there were twists and turns all throughout the movie. Now I am just taking up space.

The acting by all the actors, actresses was great, especially Jennifer Lawrence
who played a character unlike any I have ever seen her play before. The plot
was great and the ending even better. Amy Adams displayed a larger than life
sex appeal that you might expect to need to achieve the great American
Hustle.

Okay, it is a little racy, but not disgusting.  They use the f-bomb a few times, but the acting, the costumes, the music, just everything makes it a great movie.  Looking forward to watching it again.  I wished I would have purchased rather than rented.

The acting in this movie was really good, but the story line itself drug and most times, boring.  As a child of the 70's the clothing and styles were pretty accurate.  Would not recommend this movie to anyone I like!

The movie was okay, but it felt somewhat contrived. I don't even know why Jennifer Lawrence was up for an award as she didn't have a lot screen time. Anyone want to clue me in on that? Just glad I rented it and didn't buy it.

Set in the 70's, and mostly character driven, this film kept me very interested and laughing all the way through! The magic is in the small details, the dialogue(with great Brooklyn/Jersey accents), the character flaws. and the ability to turn a serious moment into a comedic one. The settings, costumes, make-up and music help you see the 70's.  It's hard to pinpoint which star did a better job with their role in this film; Christian Bale, Amy Adams, Bradley Cooper, and Jennifer Lawrence are all equally amazing!
Jennifer Lawrence, Amy Adams, Bradley Cooper and Christian Bale were all great. The plot was a little meandering but it was enjoyable.
It was good overall but it had a slow start.  It reminded me a little of the Usual Suspects but US was much better.
Along with the twists and turns of the story, there is great acting, crazy hair, and enough polyester to keep our interest to the end.

I expected alot from this movie ... instead it felt like I was experiencing what it was like to be A.D.D. The entire thing was just weird. I guess that's what makes for a good movie now a days. You just have to confuse your audience and everyone gives you a gold star.
The director should have controlled Bradley Cooper.  He was annoyingly hyperactive.  The other actors were OK but the film wasn't very interesting.
Not what i expected to be. The movie is slow and had a few funny lines. Nothing special, i wouldn't watch this again or recommend.

Not that I've had much before, but I've lost all faith in critics and pre-released movie reviews!!!!! This was not the movie that was advertised!!! The acting was ok, but I fell asleep 3 times watching this movie!!! It was the longest hour and a half (or so) I've ever had to watch. This movie seemed to drag on forever.

This movie was hyped. The cast is impressive. It was nominated for Academy Awards. Surely it must be entertaining, no?

No.

Halfway through the movie I considered turning it off, but figured since I'd paid for it I may as well watch the rest. Besides, with all it had going for it it had to get better. It didn't. I couldn't wait for this movie to end and thankfully, it finally did.

Conclusion: massive waste of time, minimal waste of dollars. Don't bother.
I thought this movie was good overall. It had a slow start but as you got I more into it the plot started to make more sense and the twists and turns are pretty awesome
Was a little hard to follow the story line at times.  And at times it was very draggy.  For the most part it was entertaining enough.
A little disappointing. Actors were great in their roles but storyline seemed short -sited. Something felt missing in explanation. Needed something !

A true story of Adscam, but definitely not my cup of tea.  I fell asleep about half way through.  Couldn't appreciate the brilliance of the scam artist...could only see the dark side.  Good acting and certainly well cast.

If you like movies such as The Grifters, The Sting, Casino. Movies that scam people, then you will love this movie. The production was 100% true to the era, very believable with exceptional acting. Everyone did a great job with their characters. Very entertaining, mildly to fast pace.
While enjoyable, I didn't find myself blown away by the movie as the reviews indicated.  Family members loved the film, I found myself somewhat bored, which surprised me.
The story line didn't keep me interested. Moved rather slowly. Liked the ending though. I would say the movie was fair.
Not much really going on here. The acting was fine but the story was boring. Wouldn't recommend it unless you love the cast.

I was expecting to be blown away by this movie, but I not. It was just ok.  The hipe was more than what the movie actually was.  There was some good acting and some over acting.  If you watch it with less expectation, probably would enjoy it more.  There is always that one costume oversight I see and hyper focus on it.  It wasn't until I rewatched the beginning that I found out it was the 80s not the 70s.  Amy Adam's hot hair rollers were from the 2000s.  It could not have been that difficult to find hot rollers from the 80s - I had mine until about a year ago.. and they still worked.  :)
I thought the acting was amazing by all 4 actors. However, it needed some editing and went on way too long.
It's House of Cards with spies, more sex, violence, and during the Cold War. You'll get sucked in to binge this after the first episode
High expectations and very disappointing. Not Ocsar worthy. Christian Bale did a good job but movie moved too slow. Would not reccommend it to anyone.

Hard to believe this was up for an academy award. This is what was once called a "B" movie. The script is smart, the film moves fast, the characters are hilarious and yet sympathetic and the music is good.  But best of all are the performances.  I never liked Christian Bale much but he is terrific here.  Amy Adams is not just another  glamorous movie star but is a terrific actress; I hope to see her grow and develop over the years; she may be the next Meryl Streep.  Jennifer Lawrence is a total delight; I loved her angry dusting scene to "Live and Let Die."  Bradley Cooper may be the weakest link but perhaps that was just his character.  I loved the guy who played the governor of New Jersey and it was a treat to see Robert DeNiro, handsome as always.  The 70's setting provided us with the costumes and big hair of the time, which are entertaining in themselves.

All throughout the film the plot twists and turns with cons and scams involving politicians, mafia, the fbi and men and women hustlers!  You think you know whats going to happen next,...and then your taken in a whole new direction.  Director David Russell gives us all the drama, tension, and chaos  you can tolerate...and then an unpredictable revelation for an ending!  this movie will find it's place among the greats! It gave me the feeling I had when I first watched Dazed and Confused, or Boogie Nights, or just about any well done, period piece, specifically, late 70s. So you take the wardrobe, soundtrack, the sets (amazing furniture and wall papers that remind me of my Grandparents apartments growing up, etc...), and the cars, and add in your favorite gangsters, wise guys, grifters, hustlers (Reservoir Dogs, Mean Streets) and you have an extremely amusing and unique look at the wild west style of business and crime in NY in the 70s. I thought the writing had it's unique moments, and what was cliche at least was done well. Bale was fantastic. Fat and disgusting, but damn good in this film.

Performances were fine--I love these actors--but I don't think I'm in the right groove for this movie.  Probably says more about me than the film;  I like dark, dramatic, complex relationships, and story lines. This was pretty much in-your-face shallow people being nasty to each other.  I'm just so not there anymore.
Amy.  Film done in the 1970sAdams did a good job in this film.  She should of got the Oscar. Film story done in 1970 s about crime.

The plot is brilliantly muti-layered. The FBI sting is full of unexpected twists and turns but never gets bogged down in boring details. Then you've got the four-cornered love triangle simultaneously playing out. The characters' lives hang in the balance while they deal with lust and jealousy, and you're never quite sure who's playing who. This film would not have worked without superb acting, and everyone in the film was superb. Christian Bale delivers his finest performance. Amy Adams is elegantly subtle. Bradley Cooper is hilarious. But Jennifer Lawrence steals the show as the incredibly gorgeous yet slightly insane disgruntled wife. Louis CK and Robert De Niro are fantastic in supporting roles. The costumes and the soundtrack are spot on. American Hustle is the best film in years.
Superb acting, great cast, very well written. The movie is a hoot. See this one you will be glad you did.

Casablanca had 'their song', a war-torn interlude of stolen romance.  Gone with the Wind had the black-garbed widow as 'belle of the ball'.  American Hustle has the comb-over.  Hilarious but far from silly.  There is something so endearing about Irving,  the quintessential warrior of his era.  His attention to his image is no less frivolous than a knight donning his armor. His love of his ladies fair, his battle with fate, his capitulation to treachery and the toll it takes on him evokes every bit of nobility as an arthurian saga.  He is humble.  He is kingly.  I was put off by the title...being sick to death of Hollywood sting plots.  Glad I overcame my bias.  Loved these characters.  Like Rick and Ilsa, Scarlett and Rhett, Irving and Sydney are symbolic of a generation.

I liked this movie. It was interesting because it was based on a true story. There was also a fantasy element of it for me because I wish there were more trashy women in my life. I didn't really care for Jennifer Lawrence because I think she overdid it at times. Amy Adams is great in this picture.

***Spoilers Ahead***

Along with Wolf of Wall Street, this movie got such a great deal of hype, not to mention Oscar awards, that I figured I'd give it a shot. Just like with Wolf of Wall Street, I was quite disappointed by it. The story itself seemed to just jump around all over the place, flashing from scene to scene before the first one was finished. The characters as well seemed very uneven as well, making emotional leaps and nosedives all over the place without any real clear reason why.

You have our two "leads", Christina Bale (who I can't take seriously anymore after Batman) and Amy Adams, that are very close one second, then hate each other the next, then are back in close again without any real explanations as to why. They are supposed to be very smart con artists, and yet they don't utilize any of their skills to get out of the jam, or even try to, until the absolute last five minutes of the movie. Not to mention their "chemistry" seemed more like distilled water as opposed to any kind of fiery heat. I honestly couldn't care less if they ended up with each other or not by the end of the movie. And as far as the "friendship" between Bale's character and Renner's character, I only have Bale's voice over to tell me about this, because other than when Renner's character discovers what Bale's really been doing do we see any real emotion regarding the relationship between these two. Oh yes, and we have the film opening things with a shot of Amy Adams' character being a stripper, something that is never even mentioned again. So my question is, why even bother telling the audience about it? It brought absolutely no weight to the movie and quite honestly I forgot about that tidbit about the character five minutes later. The same could be said about Bale's character. The movie opens with him talking about how he shattered windows so his father would get business for his glass company so he wouldn't get "taken" anymore. Exactly how was his father taken? It's never even explained. Was it done legally or illegally? And, of course, there's his dry cleaning business, which is essentially pointless to this movie other than being a set piece in the beginning for Amy Adams to have a fashion show. Even Bale's art scam was pointless, as it had nothing to do with the rest of the movie. Hell, the scam he and Adams come up with made absolutely no sense. It was never really explained. What exactly were their marks giving them $5,000 for to begin with. Was it an investment, was it supposed to be money laundering? We're never told.

You have the FBI agent (Bradley Cooper) who is so obsessed with going higher and higher up the criminal food chain that the entire character becomes a cartoon. When he beats the living hell out of his boss because he wouldn't give him an incredibly expensive hotel room for a sting operation, and is then given accolades by his boss's boss instead of being thrown out of the Bureau and charged with battery, at that point the whole movie had jumped the shark. And that's not even talking about his inexplicable use of cocaine in one scene that is never even hinted at again, regardless of his manic behavior throughout the movie.

Jeremy Renner did do a fine job in the role he was cast. The character seemed rather sincere and wasn't a typical dirty politician, which was just fine for this movie. I can't say I have any complaints about the character other than it and the actor were wasted on this film.

Jennifer Lawrence was fine, I suppose, though instead of being conniving and sneaky in her own loud way, she seemed like she was either a sociopath or someone with bi-polar disorder. Seriously, I doubt you'd have much trouble convincing a judge, even one from the late 70's, that she was in no condition to take full-time custody of her child.

Then there were the accents. I was actually ok with Adams' British accent. It wasn't great but it wasn't too terrible either. The problem I had is she was supposed to be from New Mexico and yet she would inexplicably shift into a New Jersey or New York accent when not using her British one. This is after, in the opening scenes, we hear her normal accent which sounds Midwestern. It just makes no sense. That and Alessandro Nivola, Bradley Cooper's boss's boss sounded like he was trying to do a Christopher Walken impression the entire movie.

About the only thing this movie had going for it was wardrobe, and by that I mean having the two leading ladies (more Adams than Lawrence) wear outfits that showed off their curves to the utter maximum without being vulgar for the entire movie.

Overall, I just found the movie to be pretty bad and find it very disheartening that this and Wolf of Wall Street are what is considered wonderful, powerful movies these days. It seems that the people in Hollywood really know their audiences now and know they can cram any kind of garbage down our throats, as long as their PR people tell us it's the finest cut of filet. Do yourself a favor and skip this one, or if you have to watch it make sure you don't pay a dime to see it, it's a waste of your money.

The ending did not match the overall storyline.  There were better movies that deserved a nomination. The best part of the ending was pointing out that everyone, including the people of New Jersey, came out the losers.

I didn't know anything about this movie before watching it.  For the first half hour, I found it tedious and even a bit boring.  I wasn't sure where the movie was going, or what to expect.  About a quarter of the way though, it dawned on me - this is a very dry, deadpan heist spoof with some great acting, and even better writing.

Once it clicked, I found the movie to be very funny, and I will probably watch it again, because I am sure I missed a lot.  There are a lot of sight gags which go by very quickly, but which mesh almost perfectly with the dialogue.  Some of the jokes are so subtle that I found myself laughing at things, and the questioning whether they were actually supposed to be jokes.  I think that is part of what makes the movie clever though - It is like a Wes Anderson comedy, but vastly more subtle and "mature."  One of the scenes in the movie takes a very serious dramatic exchange of dialogue, and overlays it with almost slapstick sight gags to leave the viewer very conflicted about whether to laugh or gasp.

The script is very well executed by all involved.  We already know Christian Bale can act, and we finally saw a glimpse of where Jennifer Lawrence is headed with her career.  Lawrence's role was written perfectly for her - cautious and minimalist, but poignant nonetheless.  Can she really act?  It certainly appears so, though I can't help but think that she was at times too reserved in some scenes.  This was a movie about big characters with big egos, and Lawrence's character seems to wobble between being bigger than everyone at times, and disappearing into the narrative at other times.  I am very excited to see what she does in the near future.

For all the praise for Lawrence, I thought Amy Adams really stole the show.  She was sexy, sophisticated, smart and really connected with the viewer.  Every line was on-point, and her ability to work massive amounts of context into a 5 word phrase worked perfectly with the deadpan humor.  She was the serious counterpoint to Lawrence's fanciful role - not quite the innocent ingenue, but not quite the diabolical con artist, or the ambitious federal agent.  She plays the foil between the two, and does so brilliantly.
A little confusing at the start.  Words were hard to understand at start.  Ended up very much like "The Sting"
A good movie about con men conning con men. I really liked the clothes and hair style from the 1970's totally cracked me up. The cleavage baring outfits for Amy Adams were stunning.

I loved this movie. Well worth the money and time. Wish they would make a part two. Would like to give it 10 stars

The previews looked great and I thought well I definitely rent this one and enjoy my evening with my husband. Nope...It started off really slowly to the point where we were just like ok this is extremely boring is it ever going to get better. It did at the very end we felt like, where we finally got the plans and started enjoying it. Was way to long of a movie, it could have been condensed and I do not say that about a lot of movies. My husband has mixed emotions on whether he liked it or not, He said he would give it three stars because of the great cast but would not give anything higher because of the jumpy story line. This is a movie I would not watch again and so happy I did not buy it like I was originally going to do. I am not sure I would recommend this movie to anyone else except for them to make their own opinions because half the people I know love it and half hate it.

Why this movie was so hyped I cannot figure out! Let me start by saying that I absolutely LOVE Jennifer Lawrence, and this is the first thing she was in that I didn't like - it was boring as hell!!! I fell asleeo during the last 1/2 hour and didn't bother to back up and see what I had missed - I just didn't care, I was just glad it was over!
