This movie was too slow & boring. I had to stop watching after an hour. Jennifer Lawrence & Bradley Cooper are the only reason it was on for the hour. Glad it was only a rental, so I didn't waste too much money.
The cast is hilarious...reminded me of Goodfellas ...the sting, the women, the clothes, the dancing...really enjoyed it!..would recommend to all the Baby Boomers!
It was. Little long but brad Cooper made it okay overall keep my interest and thought all actors did good job

Save your money and rent what this movie tries to be - Goodfellas.  Every part of this movie seems like it's either made for a 2 minute movie trailer or trying to capture the intrigue, humor, and slyness of a great Scorsese flick.  Long, boring, and over-hyped.

I enjoyed the film and each character was as well developed as possible but I did not find myself fulfilled with the end result of it all as I had hoped. I liked DeNiro's role even though it was a short participation. I highly recommend it but it lacks a bit of spark.
Funny and extremely entertaining piece of film art. Costumes and make up deserve an Oscar. Just first scene has place in historey of cinematography.
This is a superbly acted film by the whole cast.  The plot is complicated (for me anyway) so one has to pay close attention to the dialog.  The actors in this movie are a joy to watch.
What a ride, great actors giving great performances. Love movies with good character development and this movie immerses you in it. Buy it!

This picture got good ratings from, at least, some critics and had a number of Oscar nominations.  After seeing the movie, I find the praise and nominations hard to believe.  Except for Amy Adams, the actors seemed as if they had never been in a movie before.  The movie was based loosely on the ABSCAM scandal and loosely is the correct word.  The plot wandered around and was hard to follow in this overly long movie.  The vulgar language certainly didn't add anything to the plot or enjoyment of the movie.  I have talked to a number of people who said they simply got up and left well before the ending.  I wish I hadn't wasted my money on this one.
Because of the names in this movie I thought it would be much better than it actually was. It wasn't a bad story line, just really long and dragged out.

It's not the last word on the 70s.  It's not the first or final word on ABSCAM.  So what is it?

It's the story about the American dream, how to find it and how to hold it.  How to figure out what, ultimately, is important to you.  Could be the 18th Century.  Could be the present day.  Happens to be in the 70s.

Terrific performances and confident, engaging direction make it a story worth watching and rewatching.

Thought the premise was great didn't realize one of the players was FBI.  what struck me the most was how choppy the film was at times.  There wasn't the flow or the professional work of a scammer noticeable.
Boring and difficult to follow. Did not enjoy this movie. Kept hoping that it would get better but it didn't
The casting is very good, I like all the actors and actresses in the movie, tho the movie's content is not my major.

AMERICAN HUSTLE is a movie which is only nominally about the Abscam sting operation in late 70's/early 80's. The real heart and soul of this movie lies in the many fictional characters created for it, who are all conning each other in one way or another. Basically, the movie is about what people do in order to survive. This is a very compelling theme which is suitably explored over the course of the film, but it lacks enough narrative focus to really leave an impression. Yes, it is wonderfully acted and has some funny scenes (as well as one tense scene with a great cameo), but David O. Russell let his actors run amok with the script and it shows. On the positive side, the film features some of the best period production design and costumes, as well as an impeccably chosen soundtrack. Tonally, Russell seemed to be going for a Scorsese feel. This was nice, but I would have rather that Russell put more of a personal stamp on the material like he did with his previous film SILVER LININGS PLAYBOOK. Still, despite being a gelatinous mess of a story, AMERICAN HUSTLE is a well-made, well-acted film but not much more.
I enjoyed this film. The story is well told, and the characters are very well portrayed. The ending surprised me, which was cool because,  early on it was predictable.

I hardly ever write reviews, but I just felt it was necessary for this movie. The acting was really amazing, yet, the movie is horribly thin and uninspired. It's as if someone started with a great idea and that idea never expanded, it just stopped. It's one of those movies that end and you say to yourself "really??".

I was surprised by the monotony of the story.  It didn't seem to be going anywhere for a long time.  In addition to the blah story, we had technical difficulties with the video.  We gave up on it well before the finish.

I expected a little more from this movie, however I love all of the main actors: Christian Bale, Bradley Cooper, Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence, you don't get much better than that.

I watched it with a friend and he loved it.

I love movies that have fact-based plots and this one is no exception!!!  ALL the actors do a fantastic job and the whole story is fascinating!  So many twists and turns and in the end, you will actually feel for the so called "bad guys".  Watch it, you will know what I am talking about!  You won't be disappointed!
Top notch acting by a top notch cast.  Entertaining, gripping, funny, and excellent job of period costumes, dialects and mannerisms.
A great movie that includes a very good cast and a clever and thought provoking storyline. American Hustle deserves credit as one of the best movies of 2013.

The movie has an excellent plot. The acting was awesome especially by Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence. The men left something to be desired by the ladies carried the movie very well.. Amy has a gorgeous body and really hows it. Jennifer's her wacky self and plays the screwed up house wife very well. Her kiss on Amy was perfect.  With Amy's acting and Jennifer's it should have won an Oscar. Jen's lip singing while cleaning cracked me up. Great movie in all. I would highly recommend it.

This film is well deserving of it's Oscar nomination. From the character arcs, the plot, the sound-track, the costume design, the dialog, to the liberal use of a creepy comb-over, this movie has it all.

This movie was just ok.  We rented it out of curiosity and was mildly entertained.
Somewhat enjoyable, but highly overrated.
Multilayered and outstandingly acted.  Amazing.  The theme was presented in the most effective way but the pace over time was frenetic.
The movie is a little slow in the first half but picks up stream in the second half with some great performances by the leads.

At first I though my expectations were too high and would be let down. This movie is amazing. The actors are amazing and just so many angles going on throughout the film to keep you interested. It was definitely worth seeing and want to see again.

I think this is incredibly over-hyped. The wife, played by Jennifer Lawrence, was amazing and the saving grace. My husband was also bored and thought it was slow. They needed to edit :30 mins out. We didn't talk about it, otherwise we would not have finished. Strangely the acting was all around good, Christian Bale was also. Bradley Cooper was good, but I think he overly acted.
I don't understand the hype.  I REALLY enjoy movies, and don't consider myself a complete novice at assessing movie content, storyline, acting, period or era depiction, plot, etc.  This was a waste.

I found this film to be initially interesting for its jarring changes of time and scene, but as it dragged on it became increasingly annoying in its self-conscious focus on style over substance. It left us scratching our heads as to where it was going.  The Abscam scandal, with which it started out, disappointingly became a rather minor part of the film. Ultimately, for us anyway, this became a rather tiresome film despite its heavy-handed efforts to be attention grabbing by sowing confusion.
Awesome movie. Great story. Characters well played. A bit long but overall great. Will definitely buy it on blu ray or DVD.
Christian Bale and Jennifer Lawrence are both fantastic.  They make the whole movie.  The best movie from all of last year.

These are not people I would ever associate in real life....why watch a movie about them??
very very very disappointing!!!

I didn't even finish the film.  I rarely have had to turn off a film before finishing it as I'm a pretty discerning movie watcher.  But I don't understand the hype.  The wardrobe and atmospherics were great.  The story line and acting and direction left a LOT to be desired.  Just WHAT was the point of view in this story-telling?

Utilizing Scorsese-like film techniques alone is not adequate.  Plus if any director needed Thelma Schoonmaker to edit down a film - this director surely did.  The story was meandering and Jennifer Lawrence was hammy and it was all so trite and pointless.

Watch a Scorsese film instead, even one you've seen before.... it's better time spent than watching this unfocused rip off.
I was expecting a lot more.  Jennifer Lawerence was the best part of the film.  It was a little too drawn out and not as exciting as I expected.

It was interesting, but a little too long, and the drama was overrated.
We thought that the ending was a little predictable.

10 Best Pictures? This movie fell of it's rails real quick, I didn't care about the love affair, the story went to how a Jewish business man fell in love, yadda yadda yadda, I didn't care and turned it off.

I wanted to get to the Hustle and all I got was bustle.
American Hustle included some unquestionably outstanding performances worthy of Oscar nominations but in my opinion the story was only fair.

I had to stop watching this movie. usually I can stick it out to see if it redeems itself, but not this one. There wasn't a character in it that I liked and therefore didn't care one way or the other what happened to them. And I really like these actors for the most part. Just didn't get it.

David O Russell directed and cowrote this delightful film that garnered 10 Academy Award nominations.  The highlight is truly in the performances by the cast with the sole exception of Jennifer Lawrence who seemed somewhat distracted, incapable or unwilling to entirely embrace her character as Rosalyn Rosenfeld, wife of Christian Bale's character, Irving Rosenfeld.
Blending truth with fantasy the film follows events in the life of two con artists who become insnared in an FBI sting and agree to use there skills to ensnare bigger fish in what would become known the ABSCAM operation that took place in the late 70's and early 80's.  Entertaining from beginning to end with a great musical score this film should not be missed.
I didn't think the story had any real teeth and the character development just wasn't there.  I kept waiting for it to get better and it didn't.  What a disappointment after all the hype.

The twists and turns this film about a couple of sleazy hustlers forced to work for a crazy FBI guy keeps you guessing all the way. Based on the Abscam scandals of the 70's, it features Christian Bale as a con man with a bad combover and an inflated ego. When he meets Amy Adams and her wardrobe of low, low cut dresses (her boobs ought to get a best supporting credit in this flick) it's love and larceny at first sight. Unfortunately Bale has a cray crazy Jennifer Lawrence at home, who blackmails him into staying in the marriage by using their son as a marker. Into the mess steps an ambitious but not too bright FBI agent, Bradley Cooper who entraps Bale and Anderson and forces them to scam corrupt politicans. And then things get really out of control. It's a good watch, keeps you engaged and guessing, and it has some terrific cameos. The writing is tense and moves well, but I thought it was just a smidge too long. But that won't stop you from watching.
Good storyline, great acting. Worth watching. The advertisements make it look like there will be more gratuity then there actually is, which may be good or bad for some, but it was a great movie!
Great movie, great story line. You won't be disappointed.  The clothes, what can I say. I was transported back in time, way too cool.
Would have been 5 stars except that it's  a little too long, slow-moving and obscure in the mid-portion of this film.

different a little hard to hear and follow, but interesting with a decent ending and good character portrayal
not bad
Fast paced, funny, complex great fun!  The story keeps you guessing, although I guessed right a few times in spite of not knowing the history.  Really enjoyed it.

Good movie but I'm not sure it is as good as the critics and the Academy have made it out to be. That being said perhaps if I were to watch it a year or two from now I'd feel different. But for now its just another undercover con film. Another disclaimer, I felt the same about The Titanic at the time.
lots of great actors .being set in the 70's was cool ! great twist @ the end.good movie for a night in.

This is a great movie. It is a comedy a love story a morality tale...it is everything a movie should be. The acting is some of the best ever recorded on screen. I can't say enough about how much I love this film. Jennifer Lawrence is a revelation, just perfect as is Amy Adams. This picture should have won The Oscar for Best Picture. I have seen it four times and I can't wait to see it again.
Very entertaining and kept me guessing until the end; stellar cast. Best movie that I've seen in a while- unforgettable.
its just Ok.the stories interesting and the cast is very good  but the writting and directing leave alot to be desired
Great movie with a great plot line. The actors did a great job of personifying their characters and did an excellent job of capturing the time period of the movie.

Slow, boring, waste of time and money.  Didn't even finish watching it.  Typical for an Oscar-nominated flick, thought this one might be different. Severely disappointed, with the caliber of actors and actresses, I expected much better.
Good script, great direction, superb acting plus terrific set and costume design...all the elements of great cinema. What's not to like?
I liked it a lot. Great acting all around and a definite must see if you haven't seen it already.
We loved the cast. The movie did a great job at capturing the time period with wardrobe and background.  Story was well told.
Fun, wild, crazy...Great acting, grabs you and keeps you until the end.  The music, costumes, and hair will take you back. Enjoy the time machine.
I stopped watching this movie after about an hour because it was so slow moving and boring.  Not worth your time.
Unable to watch no sound. Had many issues with the streaming services. Its odd how the prime movies work fine but when I pay to rent a new release I have had audio issues many times.
Not what you would expect from the actors that are in this movie.  Don't waste your time or money.  Please
Entertaining. Great actors. Could have made the villains suffer more. Oscar worthy?  Not a chance. Interesting idea altogether. Watch it don't whatever.

American Hustle is an excellent ensemble of grade A actors who signed on to do a really bad film. Amy Adams plays a ghostly looking smoking hot babe in the first half of this film but fizzles out in the second half. Her makeup is poorly done. Adams is so pale white she truly looks sickly. I thought Amy Adams might seriously have Leukemia or was secretly playing the role of a mime. Someone forgot to tell Adams that in the 70s and 80s everyone had tans in the summer. Jennifer Lawrence best performance ended up on the cutting room floor. Quite frankly the whole film should have ended up on the cutting room floor. Lawrence is way too good an actress to accept such roles. Sorry but, this role makes Lawrence look cheap and she deserves better. Maybe the powers that be and a big pay day compelled Lawrence, as she is too brilliant an actress to do this film otherwise. Also noted is Lawrences hair which looks like it was styled by a low amp electrical socket. Insult to injury, apparently some producers thought they could recreate the magic of last years big winner, Silver Lining Playbook, by again teaming Lawrence and Bradley Cooper in American Hustle. Sorry folk, there is no magic in Coopers performance but the failure is the lousy script. However, those who love hair gone awry movies, get so see Adams and Cooper in hair rollers. Thank God, I can now check that off my bucket list. Christian Bale is way out of his normal element in this film and speaking of a bad hair day, Im hear to announce Bale wins the Oscar for worse hair ever in a motion picture. Rounding out the cast is Jeremy Renner and speaking of hair, every time I saw Renner in this movie, he reminded me of the Big Boy Restaurant iconic statue of the boy holding a hamburger. Renner had a small dull role that will be difficult to remember. Renner who? Looking at his performance in this movie, Renner has to be embarrassed to show his face, unless of course he has his hair on and is visiting Big Boys.

The Oscars are awards given by The Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences (AMPAS) for exceptional achievement in the film industry. AMPAS currently has fewer than 6000 voting members. In 2014, the Academy announced American Hustle received 10 Oscar nominations. With this many nods for American Hustle, I have to ask if all AMPAS members are high. American Hustle is a poorly done, boring, nightmarish monster mash of hogwash created in Never Ever Land on the Island of Misfit Movies. There I said it, someone had to say it, and don't feel an ounce of guilt for saying it. The movie insults any known existence of real human life but on a positive note, it does come with a lot of bad hair!!! YEAH

The total gross box office take for this movie is in the millions and millions. The box office take tells me, American Hustle pulled the wool over the eyes of movie goers worldwide. Therefore, the biggest American Hustle here is the fact movie goes paid to see this very small minded entertainment. O dear, did I really call this movie entertainment? My bad! The long and short of this movie is, congratulations movie goers, you have been scammed by Bad Hair Are Us. Lastly, the Oscar for best trick without treat scam of the year goes to.  American Hustle. (Applause, Applause) All seriousness and joking aside, if you are looking to have a nice nap on a lazy Saturday afternoon, this is a great movie to sleep past, as long as you don't have to pay to watch it. Of course sleeping while watching this movie means you have to pay for the electricity, so maybe it is not worth watching after all. Couch Potato Michael review, badly mashed lumpy potatoes.
for a long movie it kept you watching good flow characters could have been better developed but one of the best of the year

I went into this movie not knowing much about it except it won at the Oscars. I was touched by the the character played by Christian Bale. Jennifer Lawrence didn't move me although she is a great actress....all in all I am glad I spent 2 hours plus of my time watching.
It was good! I'm not sure it was Oscar-nominated-good outside of hair and make-up and costumes, and it dragged a bit somewhere in the middle, but it's still worth seeing.

The twists and turns of Christian Bale's sleazy conman character kept me engaged as he outwitted and outhustled Bradley Cooper's over the top, overly ambitious F.B.I. character. But the creepy love triangle between Bale's fat, sweaty, balding, comb-over conman character and Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence was completely unbelievable. Maybe because in real the real life version of Jennifer Lawrence's character was kinda homely looking and the mistress played by Amy Adams never existed. According to the original author that character was just made up to add some heat to the plot line, (sex sells).

All in all, the not so surprising twist that comes at the end where the bad guy wins and the good guy fails is fun. But the overall movie and story line still has lulls long enough for bathroom breaks without hitting pause. It was a good movie, but not a Great movie. Not really sure why this movie won Best Picture...
Good cast and acting overall but the story line is thin and uninspired. After all the hype I expected a better plot.
This movie, good writing, good acting, not too long, no effort to process a weird ending.  Just a good click.  It was up for all the awards for a reason.  A fun couple of hours.

I found the movie moderately amusing and engaging. The thing that continuously impressed me, however, were the performance turned in by Christian Bale and Jennifer Lawrence. They were so good, they were actually distracting from the story, because I kept being fascinated by their ability to inhabit their characters. So watch this movie to see two relatively young masters of the art, functioning at the level of say Marlin Brando and Meryl Streep.
The plot was hard to understand, at times. The language was too explicit for the most part. The acting was good.
The movie was incredibly slow and not that interesting.  Yes, some of the actors did well portraying the characters but the movie was boring.  I can't believe it was nominated for an Oscar.

I remember having a Diane Von Furstenburg wrap dress when I was in HS.  And I wish I had kept it !!  The clothes in this movie were amazing - I felt that it missed the mark, just by a smidge.  We watch a lot of films in our house and I was really looking forward to this one - it was slow in many parts, the acting was lackluster in other areas and the dynamics of the sting was kind of muddy.  Christian Bale was great - and so was Jeremy Renner.  Renner should have gotten more kudo's - IMO.  Good movie, didn't meet the level of accolades and press I've heard, but good.  Dallas Buyer's Club - THAT is a movie worth watching -
I just didn't get it. Myers, it looked like the 70's, so it held no interest from that standpoint and I found the characters unsympathetic and tedious.
Great movie a must watch. Great characters and great storyline. You feel like you really get to know the characters.

I am totally in love with all of these actors and thought this was a lovely ensemble piece. Being the fashionista and the cosmetina that I am, I was particularly enthralled by the late-70s era hair, makeup, and costumes. That said, somewhere along the line, things got unwieldy and sprawling, and I quite literally lost the plot, as it were - and was forced to look up the plotline on Wikipedia because I was like, "Now what just happened? Is she working with HIM? But I thought he was with that guy? Let's rewind. What??? Oh, I love her wrap dress!" Maybe this was more of a character study as they say in the biz than a plot-driven piece. At any rate, while not perfect, it was great fun and worth the $3 or $4 I spent to rent it (and to add the term "science oven" to my vocabulary).
It is funny and the actors very good. Very convoluted to the point of who plotted what in the story line.

The con within the con...if you lived through the 70s you will love this and remember when you and everyone actually dressed like that and had hair like that! If you missed the 70s enjoy a laughable, insightful, wild ride. Brilliant writing and flawless acting...and if you're a Boardwalk Empire fan you'll find several familiar faces here.
Very slow, plot was difficult to follow. Great actors, but was not impressed with the story. Poor sound quality also
Excellent movie! Definitely worth the rental and time. Both my husband and myself would give it 5 stars. Great twist ending.
It was a bit too long and i was losing focus. The actors performed great, but I was expecting more action.
Good story line and acting. Interesting approach to the ending. Strong foul language used throughout the movie was not to my liking.
A complex and thoroughly enjoyable film.  The acting was believable and the script real.  Great dialogue. I thought Christian Bale should have gotten best actor for this film.
I really enjoyed the portrayal of the characters and the story behind the ABSCAM name.  I remembered it as a kid but never really knew what it was.  Great acting.
We fell asleep.... Well three of the four in our party did. It was a mixed group but didn't hold the attention of the majority..
This movie had so much Hype.... I expected something grander ; ) It didn't hold my attention. I vaguely caught the story line.

It seems like everything 1970's is Mob or Hustler based.  This movie is no different.  Con men and woman of the 70's pulling off a scam to make millions...BLAH BLAH BLAH.  It get's boring here and there but for the most part, it's not a bad movie.  The soundtrack was a trip down memory lane, but it wasn't the greatest movie of the year...  It would be better when it's on netflix OR at Red Box for $1.99.
This movie draws you in from start to finish. The music is great and fits with every scene it's played in. Acting and story are perfect, and the cast couldn't get any better than this.
What can I say... This film just wasn't very good. I thought the story moved rather slow. The characters seemed very over the top almost cartoonish.
Fun to revisit the '70's. Loved the music. Christian Bale is a master at character acting! Really enjoyed the wife as well!
All in all, this was a good movie. I'm just not that big on the time period. All the actors gave great performances.
Great acting, great styling.  A return to the 70s and an interesting look at the shadier side of life and politics.

Great costume, great story and great actors...amazing actors! As always, Christian Bale does not disappoint. This movie is at the top of my list. I rented this movie, but now I wish I had bought it for my Amazon collection.
It didn't live up to the hype.  That's all I have to say.  That's all I have to say. Enough.
Saw American Hustle in the movie theatre, but enjoyed it just as much the second time. Jennifer Lawrence's performance is classic.
Loved the movi the fact that some of it was true made it better. You would never predict the ending.

I think the movie was OK. I say OK because this was like Casino, meets Goodfellas, meets Housewives of New Jersey. I should also point out we didn't finish watching the last 40 minutes. We fell asleep. It wasn't what I would call riveting. We now have to spend $1 to rent it on redbox for the last 40 minutes, for the husband. I honestly don't care. The best part were the ladies costumes. I want the 70's glam to come back in a major way.

Christian Bale does incredible acting...worth watching just for that.  I found the plot hard to follow.  Hard to believe that these con artists end up walking free and living a 'normal' life at the end (spoiler...sorry!)

This has pretty good acting across the board.  The plot is entertaining and keeps you interested.  It wasn't as good as some of the other Oscar nominated movies from this year, but it is entertaining and worth a watch.

The movie was LONG - meaning it took a while to get to the meat of the plot.  Additionally, Adams (who I typically adore) had the most horrendous English accent... ugh, so disappointed.  Was really hoping for a good flick.
Brought back memories of the 70's. Great acting by the cast. Almost reminded me of the movieGoodfellas. Jennifer Lawrence and Amy Adams were great.
Rarely ever give up on a movie, but this was a complete waste of time.  Never has a movie made me care less about the story.

Language was terrible. The often use of the name Jesus Christ in vain was typical Hollywood but over-the-top. The story line, if there was one, was obscure.
I would not recommend this movie. Sorry i spent the $4.99.

There was some very good acting but the flow of the story was rough often leaving you saying "what?" grabbing for the remote to rewind. It ran dry at parts and was about 1/2 hour longer than it should have been. The ending was abrupt and inconclusive relative to the detail given to other scenes. Again a couple of GREAT performances but mediocre story.
Great storyline, awesome soundtrack, and all of the actors gave over-the-top performances. Jennifer Lawrence is the Meryl Streep of this generation.

Not a Movie for someone who is offended by the "F" word. It is used profusely. The disappointing thing is the movie would have been just as good if they just eliminated the profanity. It seems it was added just to get an "R" rating. I wouldn't recommend the movie to anyone.
So disappointing. All star cast and a slow moving dud. Wait until this movie is free then watch something else. Just not worth the time
There was a lot going on. You can't get up and leave to do anything or you will miss a lot. Good acting though.
The movie is good overall, but it is really slow and very long.  I think the same movie could have been achieved in half the time.

I gave this movie five stars because of the story, and the acting.  I felt it should have won more awards at the academy, and it  wasn't a movie that I would stop and finish later.  We were glued to the television.
Doesn'tlive up to hype, but a mostly enjoyable movie.  Good acting and a relatively interesting story.  amy adams steals the scenes she's in.
Funny, interesting, entertaining and a little surprise. Great characters, you feel like you know each of them and can relate to there unusual situation this movie puts them in

Gave it a 4 star rating only b/c I thought i ran a little long. Loved the movie! Keeps you entertained with a lot of great one-liners!  Jennifer Lawrence stole the show -- as did Christian Bale. You will not regret spending time and money on this little ditty. Even my better half --- who does not care for movies -- loved this movie. Don't want to spoil anything for you, but lots of twists and turns. Go for it!
J. Law was great, otherwise it lacked the fun of a caper movie, and the grit of a crime drama. Yawn.

Jennifer Lawrence and Christian Bale were great. Everything else was meh. The story line was kinda confusing. I was kinda bored honestly. I wasn't invested into the characters at all. Louie CK was a bright spot.
Loved this Movie and have re watched it with friends. Only noticeable flaw was the music was a bit off for period.
its an alright movie its pretty slow though. u can get up to get a snack without feeling like ur missing something

It was a good movie.  Enjoyed it a lot.
Actors were very good and played their parts well.
I wonder how much was true?

Where did the Academy Awards com from? The movie should have been produced by Dream Works because it will put you to sleep! The movie should have began and ended with the last 15-20 minutes of the movie which were actually entertaining.

If Amazon gave refunds, they would be inundated with this one.
Thought is was very cleaver and was happy the music wasn't disco!  I would recommend this.  Good weekend night movie.
The biggest "hustle" was convincing audiences that this was actually worth seeing. Horrible movie, characters didn't hold my interest at all. They were ridiculous, hysterical, and boring.

Short review for those easilly angered by negative movie reviews: If the cover photo looks good to you, you will probably love this movie.

Longer review for those not looking to argue but wondering if they should rent the movie or not:
10 nominations? Has the Academy really devolved to this point or am I just expecting too much? My wife and I made it through the movie but the whole time we kept asking...is this going to get any better? It may have the worst make up crew I've ever seen...I mean just take a look at Christian Bale in the opening scene where he is doing his comb over. Honestly, I thought his bald head was supposed to be a bad looking glued-on bald cap and it was going to be some kind of joke later...but nope, it was meant to be a real bald head. It looked like a clown cap...wrinkles in the forhead and all. It all went downhill from there for me. It looked like clips from other, better movies, spliced and sloppily glued together into an overly complicated, unrealistic mess.

Bad reviews are only posted by folks who fell asleep or couldn't follow the plot??? Really? I could see falling asleep but...C'mon...who couldn't follow this predictable movie. If this one sucks you in and amazes or surprises you...well, I just don't know what to say, except that you should have stopped reading at my short review.

Did I mention that the acting is pretty bad too? Not sure if it's the actors' fault as much as the director's, because Amy Adams has been good in other movies. If you watch it try not to pay attention to the acting. Some takes are way down there on the 'atheletes in movies' level. Even my wife noticed it and she never bashes movies. I was impressed with Jeremy Renner though, despite the unrealistic overblown hairdo....again...bad makeup and not his fault. Bradley Cooper can't act anyway so it's everyones' fault for allowing him alonside pros like Bale, Adams and Renner.
I was very disappointed with this movie. Some of the acting was good, the story was hard to follow ! Wouldn't waste the money.
one of the best movies I have seen in a long time. Every character fantasticalso took me back in time with the music love love love this
Everyone in this gave a great performance and the Christian Bale probably did his best work. Bradley Cooper plays a very dynamic charactor and is clearly the real deal.
A well made film. Script flows nicely and keeps you wondering what will happen next. A few surprises and an epic ending. Very well acted.
I found the movie to be more entertaining than I expected.  Was not expecting the level of quality with the character roles. I don't like giving 5 stars but I can't give any less to AH.
It was pretty good.  I wouldn't say it was the best movie of the year, but it was enjoyable. Best people in it were Jennifer Lawrence, Louis CK  and Jeremy Renner.
Really slow. Did not finish it. Wasted my money. Apparently this review is too short for Amzon so I will add that I was bored too.

While Christian Bale and the rest of the cast gave outstanding performances, the movie itself fell way short of my expectations.  The movie was so long that I watched it in segments and it took me four to get through the entire movie. Would I recommend it?  Sure.  Just don't expect to see a movie worthy of an Oscar nomination.
Poor story development. Visuals are terrific, but cannot remember ANY plot. No wonder it got zero Oscars despite numerous Nominations.
Just a sad movie about a bunch of pathetic lives. The people in this movie don't seem real to me.

Unlike the other movies the Academy hyped that were just OK, this one was fast paced and interesting. Christian Bale was great and barely recognizable as the main character.  And of course both ladies were hot!  Great ending. Really enjoyed this one...
While the acting was pretty good, Lawrence takes the cake here, the plot and execution of the storyline were terrible.
Excellent movie. Great cast. Story has a unique ending. Jennifer Lawrence is great.  Clothing designs are true. Don't miss it.
Actors did an excellent job portraying events occurring in recent US history.  Plot was well conceived and developed. Music used to set the time period was well chosen.
i found the costume design to be distracting.  It was funny and all to see the throwback outfits but it was way, over-the-top.
Great movie packed full of drama and humor.  Best acting I have seen from an all-cast group in a long while.
It was really good.  Christian Bale is amazing with his transformations for his movies.  My husband loved it and would give it 5 stars
Good acting but despite the hype, not that good of a movie.  A bit slow moving for at least half the movie, and a bit hard to follow unless you already know all about abscam.

Great story, but poorly casted.  Clasic Hollywood where the same twenty actors are cast for virtually everything.  Renner was just especially bad casting. At times Bale was doing Deniro. What was that? Also, I am not sure Adams undertood her part/lines. Soundtrack was good. CGI was good.
Good music, story was boring...I fell asleep and never returned to the movie, later. Pointless drivel. Pointless drivel. Pointless drivel.
The acting was good and the costumes were very good but the story wandered around and got a little lost sometimes with many short seemingly disconnected scenes. Surprised it won so many awards.
Awesome actors, acting, storyline and music.  Dynamic cast and crew make this one of my new all time favorite movies

Brought back memories of that time period, especially the name ABSCAM.  Disco was in and clubbing was a fun time, probably too much fun!!

The cast was perfect as the chemistry between them, especially whenever wife and girlfriend were together created entertaining tension.  Robert DeNiro's brief appearance as a mobster speaking Arabic was mesmerizing.

Most of all Christian Bale as this overweight balding huckster and this unbelievably beautiful younger woman falling genuinely in love with each other gives men of that stripe all over the world hope.  What LOL fun!

David O. Russell is quickly emerging as the 'Next Scorsese' as American Hustle plays out very much like an homage to Marty and his masterpiece 'Goodfellas'. Russell is building a repertory company around Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Lawrence, Shea Whigham and Mr. Scorsese's former Ace (Rothstein), Robert DeNiro.  All four were able to recreate the manic energy that drove 'Silver Linings Playbook' in this period piece whose title includes a punning reference to the dance craze of the era it recreates.  While 'Goodfellas' was inspired by an earlier '70s 'crime of the century', the Lufthansa Airlines heist at JFK, 'Hustle' is about a similarly notorious latter '70s scandal, 'Abscam', that rocked politicians in New Jersey and Washington. Russell, like Scorsese and Sopranos' mastermind David Chase, is a prisoner of Rock 'n' Roll and his films unfurl like great Classic Rock albums, climaxing when the actors move and emote in time to epic recordings by legends ranging from ELO to Zeppelin, Steely Dan and Santana, all which serve to drive the narrative as effectively as his brilliant script.  Emerging male movie icons Christian Bale and Jeremy Renner (are imbued with the zany offbeat sexual charisma--bad hairpieces and all-- invented by DeNiro and Joe Pesci  in several of Scorsese's films) and Amy Adams hits all the high notes (drama, comedy, phony British accent and spot on sexy dancing) in a breakout performance as she shines so brightly that she affords the movie world's new Golden Girl Lawrence the opportunity to pick a few brilliant spots to apply her scene-stealing capabilities; via their fierce competitiveness for the affections of Bale, these two roar as the film's brassy feminine attractions. Add to all this a fantastic slapstick-inspired comic pairing of the consistently great Cooper with the suddenly (cinematic-ally) ubiquitous Louis C.K., as the Laurel and Hardy-like FBI agents who fall short of their goal to bust up the Mob's nationwide hold on gambling casinos (they have to settle for convictions of Congressmen and a U.S. Senator instead) and you have a film that you can't shake out of your system for at least a week after viewing it --at least twice if possible--much like a great Rock Concert.
I seldom "walk out" on a movie....ESPECIALLY ONE PLAYING ON OUR TV, BUT THIS TURKEY QUALIFIED. If I could give it NO Stars, I would do so.
awesome movie.  recommend, recommend, recommend EVERYONE to see.  It's funny, dramatic, satirical, it's got it all and the cast is so real and believable.

Excellent movie with a great script and a great cast. What a pleasure to watch and enjoy. Not all movies should be made for teenagers. I Loved the great and the subtle acting. I thought four or five Academy Awards were possible. I want more!
I love Jennifer, but just couldn't get into this movie.  I suppose the acting was good, but the movie--not so.

Christian Bale is amazing in it. The costumes over the top. I'm from that decade and none of us wore dress slit open down to our belly button, nor did our moms, our older sisters. Besides the costumes, the movie was highly entertaining.
It was good, but I don't see the 10 nominations at all... maybe for the acting, but not for picture.  Gravity was so much better...

There was so much buzz about AMERICAN HUSTLE that I was curious to see it. What we have is a great cast of talented actors in a seriously depressing story about con artists, criminals and reasonably decent people being tricked into taking bribes. The movie is loosely based on the FBI ABSCAM operation that took down several political figures. AMERICAN HUSTLE seems to juggle the facts and create their own version of history.
The actors must have gotten into character.  Christian Bale gained weight for the film and has an awful comb-over bald balding hairstyle, lovely Amy Adams shows extreme cleavage and Bradley Cooper has the worst curled hair known in the 1970's. Jennifer Lawrence is also all hairdo and little substance. What does one make of this?
The characters are troubled and not likeable, except for one, and he pays the price for his decency.  Jeremy Renner plays Carmine Polito, the mayor of Camden, New Jersey. Here's another character with seriously strange hair--a mountain of hair piled on a little head. It must a theme in this film. He's the good guy of the film, the closest thing to a hero in this film. He loves his wife and children and is doing the best for his city, yet he is the victim of the scam. It is hard to watch a good guy innocently take the fall but again history tells a different story.
An Aran Sheik is needed to finance Polito's dream of bringing a casino to Camden. The FBI beings in a Mexican-American (Micahel Pena) to double as a Sheik. Hey, and add in an aged Robert DeNiro, again with really bad hair to be the mob kingpin. Does any of this even remotely make sense?
AMERICAN HUSTLE may have gotten a lot of praise but it can be a hard movie to watch. This great cast of actors are trapped in a dismal story about dismal people doing dismal things. The film is a waste of talent and is worth the watch only to know what other people have been talking about.
this is a special movie--the cast is excellent across the board, well written, and executed ---you will enjoy this movie.

While this movie may just be a little too slick, it really is fun to watch.  I've watched it twice in five days and it was as good the second time around.  The characters drive this movie and they never disappoint.

Based on the advertisements I thought the movie was going to be completely different. Most of the characters weren't very likable in my opinion, but I thought the ending was clever enough to save this movie from being too bad. If you're having trouble deciding what to watch and won't mind possibly being disappointed, then I recommend this movie.

it has all the right faces and the actors are definitely great. but I have to agree with many that it started out slow to me. honestly I regretted buying it within the first 15-20 minutes of it. it seems to have the right elements but it's just not that compelling to me. I absolutely love the acting and I was totally drawn in by Bale and Lawrence and Renner and others (don't like Adams' character) but really can't understand the Oscar hype about it at all. maybe the story just was just too shallow.
I did not think this film lived up to the hype that was generated. That being said, it was a good story line with many noteworthy actors. Amy Adams is worth it alone!
Slow development of story, had to stop watching after 30 minutes, do not reccomend to any body, bad movie, terrible.

American Hustle is a good story about con men and their marks.  The story is well told and the voice over helps to fill in the gap.  Also the movie is well acted (how could you miss with these actors); and, the cast includes other folks like Robert DiNero, Jeremy Renner, and Lewis C Clark.  There's nothing new or earth shattering about this movie, but it is entertaining.
No spanish subtitles??? No way!!!!  Come on, I was waitng for this picture a lot of days... Surprise... No spanish subtitles!!!
Could not get the movie to play on my Blu-ray Player for my TV. Will try again today. Will try to get my money back.
Heard so much about this movie, and it was disappointing to say the least.  Hard to understand, and stay focused on this movie.  I wouldn't waste my time
Good movie. It has its moments, but it also is a movie that should have gotten a little more attention from the awards than the other flicks out there. a rental worth the price.
Rented it, fell asleep through it. Woke up, shut it off. Then the rental expired! Don't know what happened next. :(

"American Hustle" justifiably almost took the Oscar for Best Picture.  It is very well acted and captures the vulgarity of the Abscam period with its enormous cars with "opera windows," women's "big hair," and ugly/tarty clothes.

Acting by the two female leads (Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence) is especially good.  Jennifer Lawrence has now shown that she can play much more complex roles than her Amazon/archer persona in the "Hunger Games" films.

My only criticisms are: (1) the movie is a little long - cutting about twenty minutes would have tightened it up, (2) it could have stayed closer to the facts in the Abscam case, and (3) the role of the FBI agent was a bit overdone.

DVD quality is fine, but I wish that the movie was not preceded by several trailers for other films that cannot be skipped.
Amy Adams and Christian Bale stole the show in this one. Fantastic acting with great characters.  Supporting cast great.  Interesting storyline.
It was an okay movie, but it didn't live up to the hype.  Christian Bale was the only one who warrants any praise  He was great.

In American Hustle, con man, Irving Rosenfeld (Bale), along with his seductive partner Sydney Prosser(Adams), is forced to work for a wild FBI agent, Richie DiMaso (Cooper), who pushes them into a world of Jersey powerbrokers and mafia.

American Hustle is loosely based on events that happened in the 70's and that real story provides the backdrop for this entertaining story.

Christian Bale does an outstanding job at playing the aging and slightly overconfident and vain con man, Rosenfeld.  With the great makeup job combined with his being in character and playing the character very well, you hardly realize it is him.

This movie has a great supporting cast who do a great job in their roles as well.  Amy Adams also does a great job at being the seductive and fake British con artist who teams up with Rosenfeld as well.  And Bradley Cooper also does a great job at playing the slightly crazy and out of control FBI agent.  Also Jennifer Lawrence, as Rosenfeld's wife who seems to be Rosenfeld's kryptonite even though she is mostly nuts and erratic, does also a nice job at playing the role and playing it well.

This movie is a fun ride all the way through with its twists and turns and erratic behavior by all the main players who are all trying to con each other into doing their bidding throughout the movie.  This all provides a great cat and mouse type story that keeps you laughing and entertained all the way through, moments such as the fishing story are hilarious.

All in all this is a fun movie to watch, although a bit long, but entertaining all the way through.  Bale is great in his role and definitely deserved a nomination for his part.

One of the best ensemble pics I've seen in a long, long time. Great story, quality acting, plot impossible to outwit, devotion to '70s authenticity on sets and in wardrobe.  The characters are largely believable and sympathetic: who cons the con man?  I rented the movie twice, then bought it (this from someone who NEVER buys movies), now am buying the soundtrack.  Treat yourself~ American Hustle will keep you guessing!

A great cast and they turned in some terrific moments.  The basic story was excellent.  Pretty much everything else was seriously lame meaning the director's immediate work and all his presumed lines of responsibility.  The movie was awkward, poorly paced, poorly edited, and made awful use of some great music.  My sense was that this an effort at a Coen brothers take on Scorsese; it did not work.  I felt like the music choices were self-consciously quirky, and they were a disruption to a film that was always struggling to find a rhythm.

I was so excited to watch this movie, but overall I was bored. I am a lover of movies and I watch all of the Best Picture nominees every year, and this one did not hold my interest. The acting is superb, but the story is painstakingly slow and overwrought.

If I had read the reviews first, I might have avoided this disaster. I lasted a little over halfway though and couldn't take it anymore.

The characters are terrible. The movie is boring.

This movie has convinced me that the academy awards are obviously a scam.

Bad, bad, bad, bad...

Enjoyed the movie!  The streaming was awful! :(  We had to restart the movie, fast forward, rewind because the streaming was just terrible.  It just became annoying having the buffer constantly interrupt the show.

So many movies today are barely worth watching. American Hustle is bound to be thought of as a classic, worth watching in any era movie. If you are looking for a movie to immerse yourself into for a few hours, this is it. Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence are really incredible as is Christian Bale. The plot is great and interesting. You won't be disappointed.

Oh and this is racy and a little violent so not really well suited for kids.

Possibly Christian Bale's best performance of all time. This move is far more accurate to life than is commonly known. They just added in a bunch of social drama between the characters to make it a movie instead of a biopic. I also recommend reading "The Sting" as it is the word for word real life accounting of this same situation as it happens in the the 70's.
Really bad. Not sure why well known actors did this movie. Kept hoping it would get better but it didnt.
Hard storyline to follow which turned out to be the ultimate scam. Great job by the four main actors. Would recomend this movie
I would not recommend this movie to anyone.  It just wasn't interesting plus most of the time I couldn't tell what they were saying.
While not necessarily the best film of the year, American Hustle is an absolute tour-de-force of acting. Great stuff by all involved, and the blu-ray is fantastic!

Was with any film, about deception you have to pay attention to the flow of the story. This movie started disjointed a a bit hard to track, but eventually all the pieces fell into the grand finality con. This is a fun movie, a little to much of the Fxxx bomb, but it fit the style of the character. All in all a great fun movie for adults.
Amy Adams stole this show, complex, unique character in Sidney, she did an amazing job.  Christian Bale, loved his character's tender side.
Literally boring.  Interesting story and appreciated the ending parts.  But through it all from the beginning, I was just about to Zzzzzz....

This is one of the best films we've scene recently. Not only is this movie highly entertaining, but you have to play close attention not only to who is hustling who, but who's going down and who will remain standing. This is not a movie for anyone who wants to be spoon fed entertainment. If you watch movies for pure entertainment without doing any mental work yourself  stay away from this movie or you will be lost in the dust within the first 30 minutes. Christian Bale has once again proved that he is an exceptional actor. His performance was impeccable. And the role of his wife in any other hands than Jennifer Lawrence could have made the entire movie fail if she was portrayed cartoonish. Lawrence kept a deft balancing act as comic relief as well as portraying a hungry soul that can never be sated.

We highly recommend this movie.

Wretched film about wretched people doing wretched things.  Stated differently its saving grace is intermittent wisps of clever dialogue glued together with inept and self possessed direction which was likely sold to a studio based on its title
Thoroughly enjoyed it. Amy Adams and Christian Bale were especially good. A little heavy on the F Bombs, but that is the movie trend these days.
I really liked the story line, finally a movie with a creative story line. All actors and actress did an outstanding job portraying their character. unexpected turn of events.

At times brilliant: dialogue, acting....engrossing.... But then, other times just script lines being read into characters that are too over the top to be believed. Is close to being a non-Hollywood movie, great movie, so close. Just needed a little shaving off characters here and there.....BUT Amy Adams...OMG....  No real violence but plenty of 4-letter words. Date movie? Yes. Viewing with spouse? If prude, no.

StarUnable to view this film ,stopped several times and started from beginning,.I should not be charged for this.

Star rating 0 stars
to keep it short- this film is entertaining from the first line to the last.  incredible characters and amazing story. buy this film!

They don't make them like this one anymore - excellent acting, excellent script, and plot to spare. Christian Bale is magnificent, as is Amy Adams. The soundtrack is exceptional for creating a sense of place and time. Hard to beat a movie like this, and I've turned off more than a few films I've paid for. When government is self-serving and crooks have good hearts (sometimes) it's hard to know who the good and bad guys are and you won't in this film either, but the end satisfies with a sense of fairness, despite a chaotic big con.
I thought the movie was just OK....Each actor played their part very well, but the movie was way too long and the story was a little boring.....
This is so well written and funny and yet endearing while it tells the Abscam story with great cast in great clothes.
I just not care for the movie. I did not like the FBI character. If this was based on a true story I just hope the FBI had become more professional since then.
A very well written and acted movie.  I would have given it 5 stars if the language had not been so excessively blue.

Not only is this a great con film but the acting by everyone in this movie is great.  Jennifer Lawrence is hysterical and Amy Adams is just so cool.  Love her accent.  You will BARELY recognize Christian Bale.  His acting is superb!  Same with Bradley Cooper, he is awesome!  Love this movie and how it unfolds.  Very entertaining.  A Must-See movie!

We really thought that this was going to deliver.  The story just never seemed to get off the ground.  The 70's sets and cloths were all really well done, sad the movie just never got going.  We were disappointed for sure, the good thing is that we did not buy this.  We got it out of the Redbox for a cheap price.  Bottom line: Lame.
The reviews on this movie were spectacular so I couldn't wait to watch it! Only to be super disappointed and bored out of my mind. All I have to say is Zzzzzzzzzzzzzzz good night ! Boringgggg

This was a rare movie for me to see, where I actually found all the key characters to be interesting!

Christian Bale stole the show with one of the most unusual characters he has ever played and doing so in such an understated, yet powerful way.

 Cooper and Renner both gave their best as well;with Renner gaining sympathy points for the well intentioned politician ,who falls in with the wrong kind of people in an effort to better his constituents lives.

Jennifer Lawrence and Amy Adams pretty much draw a tie in acting ability, with a slight edge  given to Lawrence, based on the fact that she proved her ability to come across as a woman older and more jaded than she is in her real life.

The plot line is different for sure, and will send many to GOOGLE after viewing, to learn how much of the story is real vs. fictional.

All around- I enjoyed watching this movie unfold and it had an ending to satisfy all. :-)

I liked all the actors in other performances but the story and the writing was bad and predictable...Bradley Cooper's role was probably the worst performance I've seen from him.  Did not deserve any awards...waste of my money.

The female leads, Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence, were riveting in this movie showing tremendous tour de force performances with the most convincing portrayals of their respective characters.  The leading edge would be given to Ms. Lawrence who thoroughly conformed to the requirements of her role.  It never once entered my mind that I was watching the same actress from, say, the Hunger Games movie.  The illusion of her transformation was pure organic alchemy.  Unfortunately, I didn't always get that feeling about Ms. Adams, though I admire her screen presence enormously.  It must be something about her well-scrubbed, purely American image most reminiscent in the Night at the Museum role she played with great effectiveness, that caused me to ponder if she must compulsively rinse her mouth after each profanity uttered.  Ergo were the slight tings of self-embarrassment for me when her costumes were reduced to the minimum.  Not so with Ms. Lawrence.  She could make me believe anything.

This was one of the worst films I've ever seen in my life, but then I didn't like "Fargo" either which most people did. It was nominated for ten Academy Awards, though it did not win any (I can see why).

If you want to see a bunch of Eastern Seaboard types yelling and screaming profanity, this is the film for you. The characters are flat, and I couldn't get myself to care about any of them.  I disliked this movie so after 30 minutes, that I switched to the movie "Dave" with Kevin Kline and Sigourney Weaver and found it was much better than "American Hustle."

This movie was a roller coaster ride from beginning to the twist at the end.  It was certainly NOT what I was expecting but let me say I was very surprised at how entertaining it was.  The acting was all superb but Christian Bale stole the show and should have gotten an award for his performance.

I have to say that I was ready to blow off this movie because of the bad reviews but then I read some of the good ones and it prompted me to give it a chance.  When I first started watching it I was lost but then I was trying to watch it while doing something else.  This is not that kind of a movie and you do need to focus on it; once I did that, I liked it.  My husband did what others seem to be doing.  He walked out of the room and said it was weird while I ended up liking this movie a lot.

I also think that Amy Adams and most definitely Jennifer Lawrence were ROBBED of an Oscar.  Jennifer Lawrence was so fantastic in the movie that she dominated every scene she was in and you wanted her to be in more scenes.  Christian Bale and Bradley Cooper were really good in the movie too. Overall, the acting was really good and I can see why the actors and movie won a Golden Globe award; they should have won more.

Ive seen "Blue Jasmine" (slow moving, Cate was good but not enough to win), "Gravity" (boring, love Sandra Bullock but not in this movie) and "12 Years a Slave" (horrible movie and some of the worst acting, don't know how it won the awards it did) and I have to say in all honesty that Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence should have won.

I am giving this movie 4 stars (cant give it 4.5) and not 5 for one reason only, it does take focus and it can easily lose viewers and ratings because of it.  I actually liked the soundtrack but then I am almost 60 years old and I know this music.

The bottom line is, GIVE THIS MOVIE A CHANCE or perhaps a 2nd chance and give it your undivided attention.  Only then will you begin to understand why we are giving it such a high rating.  I will be purchasing this movie but NOT "Blue Jasmine", "Gravity" and definitely NOT "12 years a Slave".
Not what I expected  thought it would be diiferent I have have jot hung else to say about the movie
not enough jennifer lawrence to save it, lame, bad soundtrack, no real hook, waste of tallent, I was so sad
DID NOT THINK THIS MOVIE WAS FANTASTIC  HD Quality on my Plasma very poor and the movie stopped several times..
All star cast, great script.  Pick this up asap!  I was going to just rent it, but I'm glad I have it in the collection now
I don't understand why movie makers would spend so much money and come up with such bad a result. Very static picture, poor plot. Too much screaming for no reason. The story is trite.
I really enjoyed this movie~ not only was there good acting, but the story line was interesting & I loved the wardrobe.

This movie about the Abscam was based on a true story. The movie is essentially an actor's movie because the characters are so colorful. The cast was fantastic. There are some funny parts, but I wouldn't necessarily call it a comedy.  But, the movie was too long and could have been better with some scenes edited down and a better script. If you saw director Russell's great film, Silver Linings Playbook, or his solid, The Fighter, you may find this to be a disappointment.
Great acting. Story is just okay. Nothing suspenseful, thrilling or romantic. Christian Bale did a great job as always. Both females roles were good too.

David O. Russell made 2 consecutive fine films, "The Fighter" and "Silver Lining Paybook".  This one is a misfire.
To start with, the filmmakers have a good concept: A playful and a bit over-the-top account of a group of con men and women who tried to rip off some unsuspecting victims in New York roughly based on real events and persons.  Russell assembled a top name cast with some loudly authentic costumes, hair pieces and art directions.  The film started unexceptionally and things began to fall apart when the mafia person played by Robert Di Nero and the actor who played the sheik appeared.  At times, the filmmakers and actors seemed having a better time than the viewers.  Christian Bale was a weak lead, probably the fault of the script.  Amy Adams was more flash than substance.  Only Jennifer Lawrence and Jeremy Renner gave more impressive performances.  It is long and does not get anywhere.  It is neither a comedy, drama or serio-comedy.  Not a good film, not to mention all the Academy Award nominations.
loved it! Amazing. Christian Bale was incredible, the entire cast was riveting ! Amy Adams was pandazing.  10 stiff tomatoes!

Is it awful,no...but hardly the best film of the year. Really dull and somewhat predictable. The FBI agent was a complete caricature of an idiot who really needed to be in therapy. He was psycho enough to be a mob hit man. Compelling, hardly...Bale's role was a joke...really. Aside from de Niro's cameo this was really sad and not even laughable. Too bad I cannot even recall the pathetic ending.
2 stars is being kind.. Although there was some good acting...They just don't make em like they used to !
Not as good as made out to be.  Christian Bale is awesome in it, but overall I though it was just okay.

I LOVE the actors in this movie. Did not like the movie. I did not even finish it. Lasted about an hour,waited for it to get better. I was shocked, got such good reviews and Oscar nominations. So I am not sure ?,just never got going for me. Dark and dark,

This movie is unwatchable.  It's like a bunch of A-listers playing dress up in clichd 70's outfits and bad wigs.  And to top it off it's incredibly boring.  It tries to feel retro,  but tries way too hard and just fails.  The plot just doesn't have enough going for it.

I was 7 years old in 1978, so I can say that the clothes & hair fashions are correct, if there is one thing I remember as a kid.... it is the 70's hairstyles & clothes,  this one even has the look of a film made in the 70's, it is not as brightly colored as today's film's are, director David O Russell definately wanted to give it a 70's picture flavor, I won't review the story, most reviewers have done that, but I will say that I was engaged with these characters, Christian Bale's character is somewhat likable, but Bradley Cooper's character is more or less the character you despise, I will agree with most reviewers that this is no "Goodfellas", it doesn't even come close, the real saving grace here is Amy Adams, one of the most beautiful women on the planet, even without makeup, she is beautiful, I could never get tired of looking at her & Jennifer Lawrence seems to be the only one really having fun with her character, she is so over the top, especially the scene where she talks about microwave ovens (which were new at the time) taking nutrients out of food, it is moments like this where you just can't wait to see what she is going to say next, not the mention the scene where Amy Adams confronts her in the women's restroom & they argue, then she lays a wet one on Adams before waliking away, talk about unexpected, Adams & Lawrence save this one from being a total disaster, they are by far the best characters, without them this one would have bored me, if you are less than 30, you most likely won't like it, if you remember the 70's like I do, you will appreciate the accuracy.

The two best things about this movie are: (1) Christian Bale, and (2) the relationship between him and Amy Adams. I can't wait to see this again, because now that I realize it's really all about the two of them, I think I'll enjoy it even more than I did in the theatre. I have to say, however, that though everyone is excellent, this is really Christian Bale's show. In many ways, it's such a subtle performance, and I don't think subtle performances ever get the credit they're due. He really carries the whole movie; it wouldn't be the same movie without him. He's not afraid to underplay the role, and let the character do the talking. He's not worried about coming across as "likable" or "relatable". He just plays the role as he thinks it's meant to be played. It's a very entertaining movie, that is well worth your time.
Done in the fast paced Casino-ish / Goodfellas style. A bit draggy at times but the cast of characters are well worth the watch.
Did not like.  Acting was good, but plot was not.  A nap would have been a better option, but I kept waiting for it to get better.  Sadly it did not.

I'll be honest, this script borrows from a hundred other crime films.  A pair of Long Island grifters finally get caught and have some tough choices to make.  The FBI wants to utilize their skills at conning ususpecting "investors" to catch some bigger fish.  Without giving away any spoilers, the con artists always think several steps down the road while government agents can get fixated on the particular stage they are dealing with that day.  The plot twist will not really surprise anyone, but it does reveal a larger truth that the greedy (in terms of either money or other goals) often lose while the pragmatic get away.
An enjoyable movie to watch!  Outstanding performances by Christian Bale and Jennifer Lawrence.  Recommend to all for a pleasant evening.

While I do not necessarily think American Hustle will go down as one of the best movies ever, I do think it deserves the accolades it got for being one of the best of this year.  It is a fictionalized version of actual events, telling the story of two con artists in the late 1970s who get busted by the FBI and are forced to cooperate with them to take down politicians and mobsters.

The movie is all about the characters and the acting.  It is a story where there are really no "good" people.  Although all the characters do have some good qualities to them, they are all also very flawed.  So there is really not anyone you truly get behind and root for.  In fact, the closest to a "hero" in the story is Renner's character, Carmine Polito.  I do think all the actors did a wonderful job.  Everyone was really playing a role different than anything they had done in the past, but in my opinion Amy Adams really stole the show.  She was great in every scene she was in whether she was being a British seductress or when she was emotionally vulnerable.  Jennifer Lawrence also did a great job as the bi-polar wife of Christian Bale's character who inserts herself into the operation.  My only complaint is that at just over 2hrs and 10 min it went a little bit too long.  I think some could have been cut out to make the pacing a little bit better.

For those who get the actual discs, the movie looks and sounds great on blu ray.  As far as extras go, there are about 22 min of deleted and extended scenes, including two versions of Jennifer Lawrence's power cleaning scenes where she lip syncs to "Live and Let Die" and "Evil Ways."  There is also a short "making of" documentary with interviews with the cast and director.  Not extremely extensive, but good for what is there if you like going through that material.
Loved the story, costumes, and music.  You became really drawn into the characters.  Have seen it 3 times now since it came out.

It got really bored after a few minutes into the movie with her breast all over the screen. The script and the story doesn't make any sense. In fact, there's absolutely no story whatsoever.  Who ever thought this movie deserves an Oscar must be on crack.  Seriously. Stop smoking crack who ever chose this movies to be nominated!
 Do yourself a favor and please, do not rent , buy or watch this movie.  You will regret it for the rest of your life.

David O. Russell and his entire crew created one of the most impressive films of last year. Strange it was so highly honored by everybody but the Oscars. If ever there were a candidate for Best Ensemble Cast AMERICAN HUSTLE wins hands down. Loosely based on the Abscam, which for those who have forgotten, 'Abscam--sometimes written ABSCAM--was a Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) sting operation run from the Bureau's Hauppauge, Long Island, office in the late 1970s and early '80s. The operation initially targeted trafficking in stolen property but was converted to a public corruption investigation. The FBI, aided by a convicted con-man, videotaped politicians as they were offered bribes by a fictional Middle Eastern sheik in return for various political favors. The investigation ultimately led to the conviction of a United States Senator, six members of the United States House of Representatives, one member of the New Jersey State Senate, members of the Philadelphia City Council, the Mayor of Camden, New Jersey, and an inspector for the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service.' Given that bit of reality, Russell and cast and crew created a stingingly brittle yet funny movie.

AMERICAN HUSTLE is set in the alluring world of one of the most stunning scandals to rock our nation. It tells the story of brilliant con man Irving Rosenfeld (Christian Bale), who along with his equally cunning and seductive British partner Sydney Prosser (Amy Adams) is forced to work for a wild FBI agent Richie DiMaso (Bradley Cooper). DiMaso pushes them into a world of Jersey powerbrokers and mafia that's as dangerous as it is enchanting. Jeremy Renner is Carmine Polito, the passionate, volatile, New Jersey political operator caught between the con-artists and Feds. Irving's unpredictable wife Rosalyn (Jennifer Lawrence) could be the one to pull the thread that brings the entire world crashing down. Elisabeth Röhm is Carmine tacky wife, Louis C. K. plays Stoddard Thorsen, Michael Peña is the Mexican man pulled in to impersonate Sheik Abduklah, Alessandro Nivola is the smarmy Anthony Amado, and Jack Huston is the guy Rosalyn goes after - Pete Musane.

The costumes, hair, clothes, music and sets mirror the tacky 70s and make us all remember how over the top we were. But setting the core of reality for this fictional movie aside, here are some of the finest acting performances on film to savour. March 14
